Policy: Law of Ukraine № 1561-VI "On Wholesale Markets of Agricultural Production".
Policy_Content: The present Law defines the legal grounds of activity of the wholesale markets of agricultural production in Ukraine. The present Law regulates relations in the aforesaid sphere and aims to protect the rights and legal interests of agricultural producers who sell their production wholesale. According to Article 1 of the present Law, a wholesale market of agricultural production is a legal entity, whose subject of activity lies in rendering services to enable wholesale of agricultural production, and which has been granted the status of a wholesale market of agricultural production according to the procedure defined by the present Law. The status of a wholesale market of agricultural production is granted by the central body of executive power on agricultural policy, on a competitive basis. The legal entity that intends to obtain the status of a wholesale market of agricultural production submits the following documents to the central body of executive power on agricultural policy: (a) application to obtain the status of a wholesale market of agricultural production; (b) project (business plan) for organizing the activity of the legal entity in the status of a wholesale market of agricultural production; (c) notarized copies of constituent documents; (d) draft of Rules and Regulations for Operation of the Wholesale market of Agricultural Production; (e) notarized copy of the Certificate of State Registration; (f) a statement of inclusion into the Unified State Register of Enterprises and Organizations of Ukraine; and (g) information on the founders (participant) of the legal entity, confirmed by documents. According to Article 7 of the present Law, a wholesale market of agricultural production creates appropriate conditions for wholesale of agricultural production by rendering the following services: (a) preparing batches of agricultural production for sale; (b) forming batches of standardized agricultural production; (c) stocking, storing, shipping and delivery of batches of agricultural production; (d) quality control of agricultural production; and (e) transporting batches of agricultural production.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Black Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on 1 January 2010.

Policy: Decree on the detection of emissions from stationary sources and the implementation of some other provisions of the Air Protection Act.

Policy: Law No. XI-312 amending Land Reform Law (No. I-1607 of 1991).
Policy_Content: Article 19 shall be amended to add the following wording: “1. Land reform and land management projects required for the implementation of land reform shall be prepared and approved by the Government in accordance with the methodology approved by the Minister of Agriculture. 2. Land reform and land management projects that design plots of land for the restoration of citizens' property rights and use of land plots for private farming shall be prepared and implemented by state funds, and in other cases by natural and legal persons. Land reform and land management projects that design plots of land for the restoration of citizens' property rights and use land plots for private farming may, at the request of natural persons, be implemented at their expense. The Government shall establish the procedure for the preparation and implementation of land reform projects carried out by natural and legal persons on land reform. 3. State expertise of land reform and land management projects shall be carried out by an institution authorized by the Ministry of Agriculture. The Ministry of Agriculture determines the cases, procedure and content of the state assessment of land reform and land management projects.”

Policy: Decree No 2366 of 2009 defining the Comprehensive Plan for Lebanese Territory Arrangement.
Policy_Content: This Decree is composed of 3 Parts divided into 12 articles and 3 Annexes.  Part I considers the Comprehensive Plan for Lebanese Territory Arrangement as the general guiding framework of urban planning and land use, and therefore ministries, departments, public institutions,  municipalities and Lebanese unions shall adopt all directives and guidelines compatible and agree with this Plan. Part II deals with provisions related to the urban planning, in particular: classification of lands into urban, rural, agricultural and natural resources; cedar mountain chain; forests and valleys; archaeological sites; areas prone to flooding; landslide areas; and, areas at risk of groundwater pollution. Part III pertains to applied provisions and the establishment of the Management Committee from for the implementation of this Plan.

Policy: Decree No. 6.882 of 19 June 2009 setting the National Programme on Sustainable Development of Rural Households (PRONAF).
Policy_Content: This Decree is composed of 9 articles. It adopts the National Programme on Sustainable Development of Rural Households (PRONAF). In particular, it defines its goals and competences with the view to improve agriculture production and to ensure a sustainable development of rural areas. Special attention is paid to the regulation of practices and standards aimed at a better use of natural resources, especially water and land. For the purposes of this Decree, the following instruments and policies will be used: information, guidance and training of farmers and agrarian reform settlers for the implementation of environmental legislation; expansion of knowledge and skills of beneficiaries of the Sustainable PRONAF, by offering new technological and management standards for the conduct of activities and projects financed by PRONAF; management and technological training of family farmers and agrarian reform settlers who wish to make the transition to agroecological production systems and organic agriculture; facilitation and supervision for access of farmers to policy and funding instruments and protection of the production; and raising and providing information on the activities in family production units, enabling medium and long term planning by federal government agencies, State and Local research and extension institutions, financial agents, farmers' organizations and other entities focused in rural development.

Policy: Act on the promotiom of renewable energy sources and high efficiency cogeneration.

L’homologation des pesticides se fait conformément à la Réglementation Commune aux Etats membres du Comité Permanent Inter-Etats de Lutte contre la Sécheresse dans le Sahel (CILSS). La procédure d’homologation prévoit l’autorisation d’expérimentation; le refus ou l’ajournement de la décision pour complément d’information; l’autorisation provisoire de vente; l’homologation.

Policy: Regional Law No. 8-3427 “On plenary powers of governmental authorities in the sphere of nature management and environmental protection”.

Policy: Loi nº 034-2009/AN du 16 juin 2009 portant régime foncier rural.
Policy_Content: La présente loi détermine le régime domanial et foncier applicable aux terres rurales ainsi que les principes de sécurisation foncière de l’ensemble des acteurs du foncier rural. Elle vise à  assurer un accès équitable aux terres rurales pour l’ensemble des acteurs ruraux, personnes physiques et morales de droit public et de droit privé;  promouvoir les investissements, accroître la productivité dans le secteur agro-sylvo-pastoral et favoriser la réduction de la pauvreté en milieu rural; favoriser  la gestion rationnelle et durable des ressources naturelles et  contribuer à la préservation et à la consolidation de la paix sociale. La propriété est répartie en trois catégories. D'abord, le domaine foncier national de l'Etat telles les forêts classées, les réserves, etc. Ensuite, le domaine des collectivités décentralisées et enfin, le domaine privé qui revient aux paysans. La loi prévoit, en outré,un mécanisme de gestion pour que chaque exploitant terrien puisse en profiter convenablement. Par exemple, les paysans peuvent la louer à une personne pendant une période bien déterminée. Au terme du contrat, les contractants peuvent renouveler le contrat. La loi définit également le statut du propriétaire terrien. Elle stipule que si quelqu'un a exploité un lopin pendant au moins trente ans, cette personne devient un propriétaire à temps plein.
Subject: Livestock, Land & soil
Keyword: Agricultural development,Agricultural land,Basic legislation,Land reform,Land tenure,Public land,Smallholders/peasants,Pastoralism

Policy: Regional Decree No. 228-a constituting protected area of regional significance tourism and recreational area "Krasnoselskoye".
Policy_Content: Protected area of regional significance tourism and recreational area "Krasnoselskoye" is to preserve biocenosis, represented by floodplain ecosystems of the Gorky reservoir, performing sanitary-protective function, as well as a unique natural and anthropogenic landscapes with a high potential for use in tourism and recreational purposes. Protected area of regional significance tourism and recreational area "Krasnoselskoye" performs the following tasks: (a) conservation of forest and meadow communities of natural origin; (b) preservation of the natural-anthropogenic landscape; (c) maintenance of the territory that performs the sanitary-protective function of the Gorky reservoir; and (d) preservation and development of the territory of tourist and recreational destination. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of protected area of regional significance tourism and recreational area "Krasnoselskoye" are prohibited the following activities: (a) clear cutting, tapping of forest plantations; (b) burial of industrial and household waste; and (c) industrial construction, not related to the organization and operation of a tourist and recreational location.

Policy: Act on biofuels (No. 468 of 2009).
Policy_Content: This Act aims to promote the use of sustainable biofuels for land transportation (gasoline/diesel), in order to adhere to Denmark's international climate obligations. The Act applies to commercial energy-suppliers and sets out requirements for them to meet sustainability obligations of biofuel supply originating from waste, residues, and cellulosic material not intended for food. Every commercial companies have the duty to ensure that biofuels accounts for at least 5.75% of its total annual sales of fuels for ground transportation.

Policy: Act on sustainable bio-fuels and reduction of transport greenhouse gas emissions (No. 674 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Act aims to promote the use of sustainable biofuels for land transport and to reduce life cycle emissions of greenhouse gases from these transportation in order to adhere to Denmark's international climate obligations. Commercial companies have the obligation to ensure that biofuels emissions of their annual fuel sales for land transport energy shall be of min. 5.75%. Every year, these companies must notify fuel emission density and energy utilized for transportation vehicles with the goal of reducing emissions by min. 6% by 31 December 2020. The Act adheres to EU regulations.

Policy: Decree on the measures of agricultural structural policy and agicultural policy of rural development.
Policy_Content: This Decree of the Government of the Republic of Slovenia lays down measures of agricultural structural policy and agricultural policy of rural development and the types of support. Sustainable agricultural development is supported in the following way: (1) support to complete land consolidation procedures; (2) support of experts and associations; (3) encourage the production of agricultural products of high quality; (4) control of protected crops or food. Protected agricultural crops or food are considered as agricultural products or foodstuffs with the protected name of origin, protected geographical indication and guaranteed traditional specialty in accordance with the regulations governing the protection of agricultural crops or food. This Decree is composed of 40 articles divided into the following Sections: General provisions (Sec. 1); Measures of agricultural structural policy and agricultural policy of rural development (Sec. 2); State support (Sec. 3); Support de minimis (Sec. 4); Procedure for obtaining funds (Sec. 5); Obtaining information from the official record (Sec. 6); Funds for the payment of claims (Sec. 7); Final provision (Sec. 8).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Poverty Reduction Strategic Plan.
Policy_Content: The Poverty Reduction Strategic Plan is one of the thirty-one sectoral plans that contribute to the achievement of the National Development Plan of Jamaica (2009-2030).  It will be implemented until 2030 with the aim to achieve sustainable poverty reduction. To achieve this, the Plan targets improving human capabilities (education, health, public goods and employment) and opportunities to find sustainable livelihoods, facilitating access to basic goods and services (having regard to varying vulnerabilities and gender), and the establishment of effective, consistent and inclusive service delivery. The Plan will seek the following outcomes:  1) improved evidence-based mechanism for measuring and monitoring poverty; 2) equitable access to basic goods and services; 3) responsive public policy in place; 4) economic opportunities for sustainable livelihoods created or expanded; 5) social inclusion of the poor.

Policy: National Environmental Policy and Strategies
Policy_Content: Among other components, this Policy is informed by the concepts of sustainable development and the ecosystem approach as a means of integrating social, economic and environmental relationships. The Policy provides that to enable sustainable development, a framework of incentives, enabling and regulatory measures, and other provisions is needed to support these activities in ways that generate net benefits and safeguard opportunities for future generations. As such, the vision of the Policy is to alleviate poverty and improve the quality of life of the people of Zimbabwe. The goal of the policy is to avoid irreversible environmental damage, maintain essential environmental processes, and preserve the broad spectrum of biological diversity so as to sustain the long-term ability of natural resources to meet the basic needs of people, enhance food security, reduce poverty and improve the standard of living of Zimbabweans through long-term economic growth and the creation of employment. The goal essentially places the environment at the centre of efforts to create economic opportunities for people in Zimbabwe. The Policy proposes several objectives to achieving the goal, including; conserve biodiversity and maintain the natural resource base and basic environmental processes to enhance environmental sustainability; promote equitable access to and sustainable use of natural and cultural resources with an emphasis on satisfying basic needs, improving people’s standard of living, enhancing food security and reducing poverty; encourage sustainable development by optimizing the use of resources and energy, and minimizing irreversible environmental damage, waste production and pollution, through incorporating provisions for environmental assessment and management in all economic and development activities; promote public participation and a sense of responsibility for the environment through environmental education and awareness and by promoting environmentally sustainable lifestyles; establish and support an effective institutional framework, committed to sustainable development and able to collate and manage environmental information; and promote national interests by cooperating in drawing up and implementing international environmental agreements and collaborating with neighboring countries on trans-boundary environmental issues. The rights and principles guiding the Policy include; the elements of environment are linked and interrelated and environmental management must be integrated; environmental management shall place people at the forefront of its concern; polluter pays principle; among others.

Policy: NSW Diffuse Source Water Pollution Strategy 2009.
Policy_Content: This Strategy aims to bring together Catchment Management Authorities (CMAs), relevant New South Wales (NSW) government agencies and local councils to focus their collective efforts on priority problems to address diffuse source water pollution through a coordinated framework that promotes partnerships and improves information sharing. Its primary purpose is to reduce diffuse source pollutants in all New South Wales surface and groundwater. The primary objectives of the Strategy are to: identify new and effective ways of achieving State-wide collaboration by focusing on actions that address priority diffuse source water pollution problems; prioritize management actions to guide investment decisions and focus efforts; provide an agreed framework to promote and report on the implementation of priority management actions and partnerships.

It shall be applicable to the following issues: (a) establishment of competence of regional executive bodies; (b) elaboration and realization of state programs of geological exploration of subsoil; (c) state assessment of mineral deposits; (d) setting up and keeping geological database; (e) environmental fees for subsoil management; and (f) coordination of technical projects for development of deposits of common minerals. Subsoil management shall require payment.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Decreto Nº 41/09 - Crea el Comité de Seguro Agropecuario (CSA). Texto refundido.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto crea el Comité de Seguro Agropecuario (CSA), como una instancia intersectorial adscrita al Ministerio Agropecuario (MAG), encargada de coordinar la política de desarrollo agropecuario, en lo referente a la promoción de los seguros agropecuarios, cuya misión será la de actuar como órgano de coordinación y enlace entre las empresas aseguradoras, los productores agrícolas y ganaderos individuales, asociaciones u organizaciones de productores agrícolas y ganaderos (cooperativas agropecuarias, forestales y pesqueras), entidades gubernamentales y no gubernamentales (asociaciones, fundaciones, uniones de cooperativas, federaciones, empresas privadas y otros tipos de organizaciones) que desarrollen actividades vinculadas a la producción agropecuaria.

Policy: Federal Environmental Liability Act.
Policy_Content: With a view to preventing and remedying environmental damage, the present Act lays down provisions relating to environmental liability based on the “polluter pays” principle. The Act applies do damage inflicted on water and on land. The text – consisting of 21 articles – deals with the following matters: sphere of application, exceptions, preventive actions and remedial actions to be taken by operators, costs, competent authorities, transboundary environmental damage, environmental complaints and reclamations, penalties, reports and transitional provisions. Three Annexes are enclosed.

Policy: Act on Support in Activities of Farmers for Nonfarm Income.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to provide opportunities for increasing nonfarm income and contribute to the balanced development of the national economy by supporting the development of sources of nonfarm income and activities for nonfarm income for which farmers utilize resources and services produced by them. The State and a local government shall formulate and execute policies for the development of sources of nonfarm income and activities for nonfarm income of farmers, etc., and shall prepare administrative and financial support plans necessary for the promotion of such policies. Article 13 lays down provisions relating to special cases on support in activities of women in agricultural villages for nonfarm income. The text consists of 16 articles.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Rearrangement of Agricultural and Fishing Villages Act.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to improve and develop agricultural infrastructure, living environments of rural communities, rural tourism and resort resources, marginal farmland in an integrated and systematic manner, to raise the competitiveness of the agricultural and fisheries industries and facilitate the improvement of living environments of rural communities, thereby contributing to the construction of modernized rural communities and balanced national development. The text consists of 132 articles.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Fisheries
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Special Act on Utilization of Agricultural Production Infrastructure and Adjacent Areas.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to raise funds for the maintenance and management of agricultural production infrastructure, and thus contribute to the development of agricultural and fishing villages by developing and using agricultural infrastructure and its adjacent areas in a systematic and environment-friendly manner, while maintaining the original functions of such agricultural infrastructure. The Minister of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs shall, when he approves a project plan or a revision, designate a zone for the utilization of agricultural production infrastructure and its adjacent area or amend such designation. The text - consisting of 33 articles – deals, inter alia, with the following aspects: Preparation of Project Plan and Approval Application therefor (art. 4); Cancellation of Designation of Zones for Utilization of Agricultural Production Infrastructure (art. 8); Approval of Implementation Plan (art. 11); Access to Another's Land (art. 13); Compensation for Damage Caused by Access to Land (art. 14); Constructive Authorization, Permission, etc.) (art. 15); Special Cases concerning the National Land Planning and Utilization Act (art. 16); Complete Inspection (art. 20); Restrictions on Disposal of State-Owned or Public Land (art. 22).

Policy: Order No. 218 of the Ministry of Agriculture validating sectoral target program “Development of peasant farms and other small forms of management in agro-industrial complex for the period 2009-2011”.
Policy_Content: Sectoral target program “Development of peasant farms and other small forms of management in agro-industrial complex for the period 2009-2011” is a sectoral policy document aimed at improving the productivity and sustainability of peasant farms and other small forms of farming. The expected results shall be as follows: (a) increase in agricultural production in peasant farms and other small forms of farming; (b) improving the living standards of the rural population; (c) improving the social climate in rural areas; and (d) rural employment growth and reduction of hidden unemployment. In order to achieve the expected results the following problems must be solved: (a) creating conditions for the development of marketing infrastructure, primary processing, storage and transportation of agricultural products; (b) stimulating innovation in the activities of peasant farms and other small forms of management; (c) increasing the attractiveness of peasant (farm) households; and (d) facilitating access to peasant (farm) households and other small forms of management, as well as agricultural consumer cooperatives. In order to promote peasant farm shall be applied the following measures: (a) subsidizing interest rates on credits for the implementation of investment projects aimed at creating infrastructure for the primary processing, storage and transportation of products of peasant (farmer) farms and other small forms of management; (b) stimulation of peasant farms using highly productive animal breeds and high-yielding varieties of crops; (c) optimization of the system of mandatory reporting of peasant farms and other small forms of management to state authorities and local self-government; and (d) subsidizing part of the interest rate on credits issued to newly created peasant farms, as well as to existing farms for the purchase of material and technical resources, for the construction of livestock buildings.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Ordonnance Souveraine n° 2.214 du 9 juin 2009 portant création et organisation de la Commission Technique d’Hygiène, de Sécurité et de Protection de l’Environnement.
Policy_Content: La présente Ordonnance met en place une Commission Technique d’Hygiène, de Sécurité et de Protection de l’Environnement ayant pour attribution de: étudier et de proposer des règles propres à permettre d’assurer sous tous les aspects la sécurité, l’hygiène, la salubrité, la tranquillité publique et la protection de l’environnement notamment en matière de travail et de protection des biens et des personnes, et de surveiller l’application des textes en la matière. La Commission Technique d’Hygiène, de Sécurité et de Protection de l’Environnement intervient à l’occasion de la construction, de l’aménagement, de la modification, de l’ouverture ou de l’exploitation; proposer l’application de toute méthode; prévenir, d’éviter, de réduire et de lutter contre les pollutions et les nuisances; lutter contre les troubles inhérents aux constructions, aménagements, modifications, ouvertures ou exploitations visés au paragraphe et généralement à tout chantier ; de prévoir et faciliter l’accessibilité aux personnes à mobilité réduite; s’assurer que les manifestations à caractère exceptionnel, récurrentes ou non telles que des spectacles, des salons ou foires et autres rassemblements de public peuvent se dérouler dans de bonnes conditions de sécurité, d’hygiène et de protection de l’environnement ; vérifier les conditions de transport des matières dangereuses ; ainsi que toute mission qui pourrait lui être confiée sur saisine du Département des Relations Extérieures en regard des engagements internationaux de la Principauté de Monaco.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Western Europe

Policy: Sub-Decree No. 83 ANK,BK providing for the Procedures of Registration of Land of Indigenous Communities.
Policy_Content: The purposes of this Sub-Decree are to determine principles, procedures, and mechanisms for the registration of land of indigenous communities as collective title. The objectives of this Sub-Decree are to provide indigenous communities with legal rights over land tenure, to ensure land tenure security, and to protect collective ownership by preserving the identity, culture, good custom and tradition of each indigenous community. This Sub-Decree has the scope of application for indigenous communities which have legally been established as legal entity in the territory of the Kingdom of Cambodia. General principles that shall be applied to the registration of land of an indigenous community are below: The registration of land of indigenous communities is the registration of all pieces of land of a community as collective title on a single cadastral map. The collective title certificate which will be issued to community should specify the name and location of the community, reference number to the single cadastral map indicating the location, size, boundary, co-ordinates of the land plot collectively owned and certification of the type of land use and other notes. Communities established as a legal entity with registered statute and official recognition can apply for land registration as collective title. Community shall be officially established as legal entity which has internal rule stipulating the management and collective land use as well as setting some conditions such as collective land management and land use according to land type and reconciliation at community level in case of conflict over traditional land use.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Regional Law No. 67-OZ “On promotion of oversnow tourism”.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Regional Law shall be to promote oversnow tourism. The purposes of regulation shall be: (a) development of new type of tourism; (b) promotion of ecological and ethnographic tourism; (c) ensuring safety of citizens practicing oversnow tourism; (d) environmental protection; (e) stimulation of new sphere of entrepreneurial activity; and (f) creation of favourable start-up conditions for investments in tourism. Mandatory condition for organization of oversnow tracks shall be submittal of project documentation by tourist organization of agency to the authorized regional state institution in the sphere of tourism. Oversnow tracks shall be operative prior issuance of authorization by the aforesaid institution. State support of oversnow tourism shall be performed in the form of preferential payment of taxes and dues and in the form of public financial support in accordance with long-term specific programs for promotion of tourism.

Policy: Law No. 13.787 creating the State System of Nature Conservation Unit (SEUC).
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 69 articles divided into 10 Chapters, creates the State System of Nature Conservation Unit (SEUC) within the State of Pernambuco. It establishes authorized forestry activities, criteria and norms for the creation, settlement and management of related Forestry Units and provides for the support and incentives to this System, and regulates offences and penalties for forestry illegal activities. SEUC has the following objectives: contribute to the maintenance of biological diversity and genetic resources in the state territory and in jurisdictional waters; protect endemic, rare and endangered species at the state level; protect native species of relevant economic, social or cultural value; contribute to the preservation and restoration of the diversity of state natural ecosystems; promote the use of the principles and practices of nature conservation in the process of sustainable state development; protect natural and altered landscapes of remarkable scenic beauty; protect the relevant geological, speleological, archaeological, paleontological and, when applicable, historical and cultural characteristics; protect and recover water and soil resources; restore degraded ecosystems, etc.

Policy_Content: The Governor decrees that Regional Forest plan shall be mandatory guiding document for state forest management bodies at all levels. Forest plan contains characteristics of the state of forests, classification of forests by categories and forest species. It also contains information on the amount of timber extraction, forest fire protection arrangements and pest control measures. Decree sets forth the main directions of forest management, forest protection, and afforestation and reforestation arrangements. Forest plan also contains assessment and evaluation of economic efficiency of forest management.

Policy: Regional Law No. 34-OZ “On some issues of protection of the population and territory against natural and technological disasters”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law has as its purpose prevention of the outbreak and propagation of natural and technological disasters, reduction of losses caused thereby and mitigation of the consequences thereof, and also delimitation of plenary powers of state bodies in the aforesaid sphere. Regional state bodies shall perform collection and exchange of information related to natural and technological disasters, early warning of the population and information of the population of the disaster risks. Policy: Regional Law No. 221-47 “On industrial policy”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations originating between subjects operating in the sphere of industry, regional and state bodies and local self-government in the process of formation and implementation of industrial policy. Industrial production shall be intended extraction of minerals, processing industry, electric energy and gas supply, water abstraction and water supply. The tasks of industrial policy shall be as follows: (a) formation and development of modern industry; (b) stimulation of industrial activity; (c) introduction of ecofrienfly processes and resource saving technologies; (d) increase of industrial production output; (e) reduction of disaster risks; and ensuring technological independence of the regional economy.

Policy: Regional Law No. 26-RZ “On Civic Chamber”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that Civic Chamber shall be permanent body with a view of promoting civil society institutions, ensuring public control and cooperation of citizens with state bodies and local government. Its scope shall be protection of rights and duties of citizens, social associations and other non-government bodies (NGOs). Civic Chamber shall perform the following tasks: (a) communication to state bodies and local government of the regional public opinion; (b) open and transparent public hearing and elaboration of recommendations to state bodies and local government; (c) performance of public expertise of federal legislation of joint competence (federal and regional); (d) exercise of public control over local government bodies; (e) advancement of civil initiatives and elaboration of programs for the development of civil society.

Policy: Resolution No. 27/2009 approving the Strategy on the Concession of Areas for Oil Operations.
Policy_Content: This Strategy aims to ensure the continuation of systematic hydrocarbon research in the Mozambique and Rovuma basins and to promote investment in hydrocarbon research and production in the national territory or international areas, including the territorial sea and the exclusive economic zone and continental shelf, as well as to define the prospective areas of priority for the pursuit of the activity in accordance with internationally accepted industrial good practices. In addition, it aims to guarantee the continuation of related systematic research in the country's sedimentary basins, encouraging the national private sector to invest in oil research and production activities and promote foreign investment in research and production within the national territory.  In order to achieve these objectives, the Strategy establishes five Strategic Actions to be implemented, namely: 1) Definition of areas which are subject to public tender, considering their petroleum potentiality. 2) Definition of areas to be subject to simultaneous and direct negotiation and reserve areas, taking into account geological prospectivity, data volume and risk based on positive or negative results in adjacent areas. 3) Division of the concession areas into blocks of relatively smaller areas. 4) Opening international public tenders for the granting of rights. 5) Participation of the national business sector in oil operations.
Subject: Energy, Mineral resources

Policy: Décret n° 2009-636 du 8 juin 2009 portant création de l'Etablissement public foncier de Bretagne.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée l’Etablissement public foncier de Bretagne, un établissement public de l'Etat, à caractère industriel et commercial, doté de la personnalité morale et de l'autonomie financière.  Cet établissement est habilité dans la région Bretagne à : procéder à toutes les acquisitions foncières et opérations immobilières de nature à faciliter l'aménagement au sens de l'article L. 300-1 du code de l'urbanisme et spécialement le logement, notamment social, le renouvellement urbain, la reconversion des friches industrielles et militaires, le développement d'activités économiques d'intérêt régional et à contribuer à la protection des espaces agricoles et à la préservation des espaces naturels remarquables ; procéder à la réalisation des études et travaux nécessaires à l'accomplissement des missions définies au 1° ci-dessus et à participer à leur financement.  Les missions définies ci-dessus peuvent être réalisées par l'établissement public soit pour son compte ou celui de l'Etat et de ses établissements publics, soit pour le compte des collectivités territoriales et de leurs groupements, lorsque des conventions ont été passées avec eux.  L'Etablissement public foncier de Bretagne peut passer avec la Société d'aménagement foncier et d'établissement rural de Bretagne, le Conservatoire de l'espace littoral et des rivages lacustres et tout établissement public exerçant des compétences en matière foncière des conventions-cadres qui définissent leurs modalités de coopération.

Policy: Arrêté du Gouvernement flamand modifiant l'arrêté du Gouvernement flamand du 5 mars 2004 favorisant la production d'électricité à partir des sources d'énergie renouvelables.
Policy_Content: Le présent Arrêté du Gouvernement flamand modifie l'arrêté du Gouvernement flamand du 5 mars 2004 favorisant la production d'électricité à partir des sources d'énergie renouvelables. Notamment, on modifie, entre autres, l’article 3 concernant l’attribution des certificats d'électricité écologique; l’article 5 sur les installations de production à l'aide d'énergie solaire; et l’article 9 concernant la production d’électricité. L’administration a pour mission dans les limites des lois et règlements: a) la protection de la nature, des ressources naturelles, de la diversité biologique et des paysages; b) la protection et la gestion forestière durable des forêts soumises au régime forestier; c) la promotion d’une gestion forestière durable dans les forêts privées; d) la protection et la gestion durable des ressources cynégétiques; e) la sensibilisation du public dans les domaines de la nature et des forêts; f) la surveillance et la police en matière de protection de la nature, des forêts, de chasse et de pêche. Policy: Act on natural areas in Oslo and nearby communities (Forest Act) No. 35 of 2009.
Policy_Content: The purpose of the Act is to promote and facilitate outdoor recreation ensuring Marka's borders and preserve a natural and cultural heritage, as well as sustainability thereof. The geographical area Marka is composed by the following areas: Kjekstad Marka, Vard Åsmarka, Vestmarka Krokskogen, Bærumsmarka, North Marka, Lillomarka, Romeriksåsene, Gjellerås Marka, Østmarka and Sørmarka. Marka is an agricultural, natural and recreational area (LNF area) pursuing Act relative to planning and construction. In areas that are protected by the Environment Act for conservation purposes, the conservation or protection areas for drinking water shall be subject to restrictions following specific safety and planning decisions. Dispensations can only be granted if there is a legislative intent to the exemption of assessment of natural environment and may not apply to the requirement of development plans set by the Act relative to planning and construction and other rules. Municipality authorities supervise the provisions laid down in this Act and decides on the conditions present with minimal impact on the environment. Further provisions of the Act relative to planning and construction shall be implemented together with this Act.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Law No. 14.933 creating the Policy on Climate Change within the Municipality of São Paulo.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 51 articles divided into seven Titles, creates the Policy on Climate Change within the Municipality of São Paulo. This Policy aims at the following principles: prevention guiding public policies; lack of full scientific certainty should not be used as a reason for postponing measures to combat the worsening of the greenhouse effect; polluter pays avoiding environmental damage resulting from pollution; user-payer must pay for the use of natural resources; protector-receiver, ensuring that nature provides environmental services to society; common but differentiated responsibilities according to which each one's contribution to the mitigation effort must be scaled according to their respective responsibility for the impacts of climate change; holistic approach, taking into account local, regional, national and global interests; internalization in the context of enterprises, their social and environmental costs; right of access to information, public participation in the decision-making process and access justice on climate change issues.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 335 validating the Regulation on forest monitoring.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities of carrying out forest monitoring classified as follows: (a) forest monitoring; (b) forest pathology monitoring; (c) forest fire monitoring; (d) forest organization monitoring; and (e) forest outlook. Forest monitoring includes monitoring of state forest fund, protected areas, municipal and private forests. Forest monitoring shall be based on data obtained from national forest inventory, forest registration, forest management projects etc. Forest monitoring shall be carried out at national and local levels. Forest monitoring shall include the following four mandatory gradual stages: (a) observation (surveillance); (b) analysis and evaluation of the situation; (c) outlook of the state of forests; and (d) decision-making.

Policy: Law No. 13.550 providing for the use and protection of native vegetation of the Cerrado Biome in the State.
Policy_Content: The Law, consisting of 11 articles, establishes that the conservation, protection, regeneration and use of the Cerrado Biome within the State shall also comply with the provisions of the environmental legislation in force, in particular Federal Law No. 4.771 of 15 September 1965 on the Forest Code. Only native vegetation shall have their use and suppression regulated by this law, which shall not apply to the areas occupied by pastures formed by exotic species, by agricultural crops and by planted forests, subject to the provisions of the federal legislation. This Law prohibits the suppression of vegetation in any of area of the Cerrado Biome when it shelters flora and fauna endangered species included in the following categories as defined by International Union for the Conservation of Nature (IUCN): a) regionally extinct (RE); b) critically endangered (CR); c) endangered; d) vulnerable (VU); it functions as a protection of springs and recharge of aquifers; it forms corridors between primary or secondary vegetation at an advanced stage of regeneration; it is located in an enclosure area of ​​an integral protection conservation unit and presents a protective function of the biota of the protected area as defined in the management plan; it possesses exceptional landscape value, recognized by the Public Power; it is located in priority areas for the preservation and creation of conservation units determined by official scientific studies or acts of the public power in specific regulations.

Policy: Drugs and Poisons Act of 2009.
Policy_Content: This Act consisting of 40 articles provides for the operations of import, manufacture, control, storage, pricing, transport and use of drugs, cosmetic preparations, all medical requisites and pharmaceutical preparations. Responsible body is the National Drugs and Poisons Board, established according to article 4 of this Act. Main tasks of the Board are as follows (i) lay down conditions necessary to license drugs stores, pharmaceutical laboratories, drugs factories, veterinary vaccines, serums and drugs information bureau; (ii) procedures pertaining to registration; (iii) lay down rules for practice and management by the pharmaceutical facility; (iv) register foreign drugs; (v) license the conduct of drugs experiments both on animals and human beings; (vi) establish requisites of pharmaceutical and cosmetic preparations regarding safety, effectiveness, price, quality and protection of the consumer; (vii) approve exportation of drugs and pharmaceutical preparation; (viii) control the quality and distribution of the drugs; and (ix) prepare a list of poisons (divided in dangerous anesthetic substances, non-dangerous drugs, and poisons other than drugs) and publish the same in the Gazette. The National Reference Laboratory, together with other validated laboratories, is responsible for issuing the certificates related to both imported and locally manufactured drugs and pharmaceutical preparations.

Policy: Order No. 142 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on state nature reserve of federal significance “Voronezhsky”.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that on state nature reserve of federal significance “Voronezhsky” shall be classified as biological (zoological) protected area destined for conservation and reproduction of rare and endangered wild fauna species constituted for an indefinite time period. Nature reserve shall be located in the Voronezh region and shall be under the direct jurisdiction of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology. It shall perform the following tasks: (a) conservation of natural complexes; (b) conservation and reproduction of wild fauna species, including rare and endangered species; (c) protection of natural habitats and migratory routes of wild fauna species (d) scientific research; (e) ecological monitoring; and (f) ecological education. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of state nature reserve: (a) all types of hunting; (b) commercial fisheries; (c) procurement of non-timber products; (d) any activity causing modification of hydrogeological regime, including drainage and land reclamation; (e) exploration, mining and use of explosives; and (f) introduction and release of alien species.

Policy: Framework Act on Agriculture and Fisheries, Rural Community and Food Industry.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to provide for basic matters concerning directions to be sought by agriculture, fisheries, rural communities and the food industry and directions of national policy in order to pursue the sustainable development of agriculture, fisheries, and rural communities to stably supply safe agricultural and fishery products, and to enhance the level of income and quality of life of farmers and fishermen. The State and local governments shall formulate and implement comprehensive policies in order to promote the sustainable development and public functions of agriculture, fisheries and rural communities by training human resources for agriculture and fisheries in rural communities,  securing the safety of agricultural and fishery products in the production stage, development of agriculture, fisheries and the food industry, and setting and maintaining of optimum goal of self-sufficiency of food and staples. The Minister of Food, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries shall establish the Korea Agency of Education, Promotion and Information Service in Food, Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries ("EPIS") to efficiently promote development of human resources for agriculture and fisheries, facilitation of the information of agricultural food and rural communities, propagation and publicity of the value of rural community cultures, enhancement of the ability of agricultural and fishery business entities and provision of safety information on agricultural and fishery products. For the strengthening of environment preservation functions the State and local governments shall formulate and implement policies necessary for the construction of production infrastructure for environment-friendly agriculture, fisheries, etc., development of production technologies, production methods, fishing methods, fishing gear, and aquaculture technologies, certification of environment-friendly agricultural and fishery products.

Policy_Content: La présente Directive vise à assurer la mise en place au sein de l’Union d’un cadre conceptuel harmonisé du secteur minier. Les objectifs de la présente Directive sont: assurer l’harmonisation des principes directeurs et des politiques dans le secteur minier des Etats membres basés sur des normes standard de haut niveau de responsabilité pour les compagnies minières et les gouvernements afin de promouvoir les droits de l’homme, la transparence et l’équité sociale et  de  garantir  la  protection  des  communautés locales et de l’environnement dans les zones minières de la sous-région; créer un environnement minier favorable au développement macroéconomique durable et qui assure un équilibre entre la nécessité de mettre en place des mesures incitatives pour attirer les investisseurs et celle de protéger la base du revenu et les ressources des Etats membres; améliorer  la  transparence  dans  le  processus  de  formulation  et  de  mise  en  oeuvre  de  la  politique  minière  dans  la sous-région, promouvoir la participation et renforcer les capacités des communautés minières; doter les Etats membres d’une politique minière et d’un cadre juridique harmonisés; et s’assurer que l’harmonisation prend en compte les différents niveaux auxquels chaque Etat membre se trouve dans le secteur minier et la manière dont les politiques et les différentes stratégies pourraient être conduites pour satisfaire les besoins spécifiques de chaque Etat membre.

Policy: Act No. XXXVII of 2009 on forests, on the protection and management of forests.
Policy_Content: This Act provides a comprehensive frame for forestry management and forest protection. It is considered the most rigorous forest act in Europe. The Act is divided into thirteen sections. The objective of the Act is, through the regulation of the relation between forests and the society, and, in particular, through the determination of sustainable requirements of forest management, to assure the maintenance, the protection, the growth, and the increase of its positive effects on the environment, the society and the economy. In Section I, general rules regarding forests and forest management are set out. Forests must be divided into planning districts. These are the units with regard to planning and monitoring of sustainable forest managing activities. Forests are registered in the National Forest Database. Forest manager (the proprietor or the user) are also registered. The Act foresees also the establishment of the National Forest Council that is an opinion and proposal maker body. Section II deals with the destination and operational mode of forests. Forests are to be classified with regard to their primary destination: protection, public welfare and economic use. Section III regulates forest planning and the reporting-authorization system of forestry activity. Section IV regards forestation. Section V provides rules for the restoration, bringing-up and restructuring of forests. Prevention and protection against harms (caused by pests, wildlife, harmful activities, fire) to forests and the soil are rules in Section VI. Section VII regards profitable activities in forests, such as timber extraction, collection of propagating material, collection of galipot. In Section IX on the use of forests for transporting and on the visiting of forest, contains an important title regarding the certification of origin of timber. Section X provides rules on professional governance of forestry works, forest workers and on the forest guarding service. Forest administration is provided for in Section XI. Penalties are set forth in Section XII.

Policy_Content: La Política Nacional del Ambiente es un instrumento de carácter multisectorial y cobertura nacional, que se sustenta en los principios contenidos en la Ley General del Ambiente y que tiene como objetivo mejorar la calidad de vida de las personas garantizando la existencia de ecosistemas saludables, viables y funcionales en el largo plazo, y el desarrollo sostenible mediante la prevención, protección y recuperación del ambiente y sus componentes, la conservación y el aprovechamiento sostenible de los recursos naturales, de una manera responsable y congruente con el respeto de los derechos fundamentales de la persona. Policy: Decree No. P. 36/Menhut - II/2009 regarding procedures for licencing of commercial utilization of carbon sequestration and/or storage in production and protected forests.
Policy_Content: License for utilizing environmental services of timber in natural forest, of timber from Plantation Forests, of IUPHHK-RE (UPHHK Restoration Ecosystem within natural forest is a license for business given to develop natural forest area of important ecosystem), of timber from Community Plantation Forest shall be subject to authorization by the Ministry of Forestry. Carbon sequestration and/or carbon storage (UP RAP-KARBON and/or UPPAN-KARBON) is a methodology of commercial utilization of environmental services in protected forests whereby planting, maintenance, harvesting, sylviculture, and selective logging shall increase productivity. Request for compliance with criteria set by licensing requirements in areas not possessing permit for utilization of forest timber products is mandatory. Licenses may be issued by the Head of District/City (article 9) which shall be responsible for the Management of Forest Production between the permit holder (entity) and the investor with regards to trade, maintenance and development of forest resources, capacity development of local community and project development/replication for the surrounding areas. The results of project development activities are carbon commodities, which can be marketed on the national or international carbon market.

Policy: Law No. 1392-VI "On Coalbed Gas (Methane)".
Policy_Content: The Law establishes legal, economic and organizational grounds for activity in the field of geological research of coalbed gas (methane), including research and industrial development, extraction and removal during degassing, and further use of it as a material and/or energy resource. Article 1 of the Law defines the main terms used therein. Coalbed gas (methane) is a mixture of gases that accompanies coal beds and adjoining rock. The Law applies to relations that arise in relation to geological exploration of mineral resource reserves; further extraction of coalbed gas (methane) from coal deposits not developed industrially, regardless of their future use; extraction of coalbed gas (methane) during degassing of active mines, mines being prepared for exploitation and abandoned coal deposits; use of coalbed gas (methane) as a material and/or energy resource (Article 2). Article 6 of the Law establishes that the state policy in the field of geological exploration, extraction and use of coalbed gas (methane) is based on the grounds of: (a) state regulation of geological exploration, extraction and use of coalbed gas (methane); (b) facilitating diversification of energy carrier sources; (c) environmental protection; (d) ensuring rational use of mineral resources; and (e) developing international cooperation and implementing innovative technologies in the respective field. Article 13 specifies that extraction of coalbed gas (methane) as well as geological exploration and industrial development of deposits shall be subject to licensing and shall be carried out in accordance with special permits. According to Article 16 it shall be prohibited to burn coalbed gas (methane) extracted during degassing, directly from the well in open-cut mining, without the use of special equipment with appropriate operational documentation.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Black Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA

Policy: Law No. 526 “On dehkan (peasant) farm”.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes legal grounds for setting up and functioning of dehkan (peasant) farms, and autonomous economic entity having the form of enterprise based upon labour of an individual or a group of persons performed on a plot of land pertaining to the members of dehkan (peasant) farm. Dehkan (peasant) farm registered as association or partnership shall be regulated by contract concluded by its members (Art. 6). The purpose of dehkan (peasant) farm shall be production of agricultural commodities, and also processing, handling, transport and storage thereof (Art 8). Members of dehkan (peasant) farm and members of family dehkan (peasant) farm shall have the right to set up agricultural cooperative having the status of legal persons (Art. 14). Plot of agricultural land shall be allotted as a single plot to dehkan (peasant) farm by decision of local executive bodies on condition of hereditary life-long possession (Art. 15). Dehkan (peasant) farm shall be granted access to land based credits conceded by banks in accordance with credit contracts (Art. 27).

Policy: Law No. 522 “On technical regulation”.
Policy_Content: This Law, regulating the relations arising in the process of elaboration and validation of mandatory technical requirements for commodities, production processes, manufacturing, operation, storage, transportation, trade, recycling of industrial waste and performance of works and rendering of services regarding safety of produce. It establishes the rights and duties of participants of the aforesaid relations. Produce safety must prevent risks for public health, life and environment. Produce must pass safety compliance test and certification for compliance with technical standards. Technical regulation shall be the competence of the authorized state institution. Technical regulation shall be based upon application of mandatory technical regulations and standards. The scope of application of technical regulations shall be as follows: (a) protection of human life and health, property of individuals and legal entities, public property; (b) protection of animals and plants; (c) protection of environment; and (c) prevention of actions misleading consumers. Elaboration of technical regulations for other purposes shall be prohibited.

Policy_Content: La présente loi définit les droits et les devoirs inhérents à la protection et à la promotion de la santé de la population. The authorities regarding the protection of marine environment are delegated to the Port Authorities under the Undersecretariat of Maritime Affairs, the Subordinate Commands under the Turkish Coast Guard Command, and the Department of Environmental Protection and Control under the Metropolitan Municipalities in İstanbul, Kocaeli, Antalya and Mersin. Policy: Decree No. 61 of 2009 (V. 14.) FVM of the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development laying down the conditions of support for agricultural environmental management from the European Agricultural Fund for Rural Development.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Decree is to develop production structure that are suitable to the given production site and to develop environmentally conscious farming and sustainable agricultural practices. In this context, other objectives of this Decree are: improving environmental quality, high quality food production, support farms and improve their economic efficiency through the reimbursement of extra costs and lost income due to the obligations undertaken for the implementation of the measures and programs defined by this Decree. Article 3 lists the agricultural environmental management measures that can be supported. Terms of application for support under this Decree are set in Articles 4-6. The eligible areas and other criteria for eligibility are also laid down in Articles 7-10. General rules and special rules of undertaking obligations are provided in Articles 11-17. According to Article 18, the entitled farmers must keep an up-to-date register concerning their activity a sample of which is shown in Annex 21. The monitoring system is dealt with in Article 19. Transfer of obligations undertaken may be done in conformity with rules defined in Articles 23-25. Rules of withdrawal of areas from the programs are set in Articles 26-27. Rules regarding the scale and the determination of payments are provided in Articles 29-30. Provisions regarding the presentation of application for support, rules of proceeding and payment are contained in Articles 31-44. Control of the implementation of obligations undertaken is ruled in Articles 45-47. Sanctions are foreseen by Articles 48-56. Chapter II (Articles 58-78.) lays down detailed rules of application of each support.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen.
Keyword: Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Financial agricultural measures,Subsidy/incentive,Special fund,Sustainable development,Sustainable use

The requirements and conditions of making available on the market and use of a biocidal product and a treated article are established in Regulation (EU) No 528/2012 of the European Parliament and of the Council concerning the making available on the market and use of biocidal products. This Act applies to making available on the market and use of a biocidal product and a treated article in events not regulated by the Biocidal Products Regulation. The projects may concern both freshwater resources and marine areas and may be based on the Decree on the management of the aquatic environment quality (2004:660) Decree (2010:1341) relative to protection of the marine environment. They may be about, for example, the recovery of lost fishing gear, the prevention of excessive phosphor in beds, or the eutrophication of the aquatic environment.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 537 validating the National Security Strategy of the Russian Federation for the period up to the year 2020.
Policy_Content: The National Security Strategy of the Russian Federation until 2020 is an officially recognized system of strategic priorities, goals and measures in the field of domestic and foreign policy, determining the state of national security and the level of sustainable development of the state in the long term. The forces and means of ensuring national security focus their efforts and resources on ensuring national security in the domestic political, economic, social spheres, in the field of science and education, in the international, spiritual, informational, military, defense-industrial and environmental spheres, as well as in the sphere of public security. To ensure national security, the Russian Federation, along with the achievement of the main priorities of national security, focuses its efforts and resources on the following priorities of sustainable development: (a) improving the quality of life of Russian citizens by guaranteeing personal security and high standards of living standards and healthcare; and (b) ecology of living systems and rational environmental management, the maintenance of which is achieved through balanced consumption, the development of advanced technologies and the appropriate reproduction of the country's natural resource potential.  1) One of the main directions of ensuring national security in the medium term is determined by food security. Food security shall be ensured through the development of biotechnology and import substitution for basic foodstuffs, as well as by preventing depletion of land resources and reducing agricultural land and arable lands, capturing the national grain market by foreign companies, uncontrolled distribution of food products obtained from genetically modified plants using genetically modified microorganisms and microorganisms having genetically modified analogs.

Policy: Política Nacional de la Quinua.
Policy_Content: Este documento tiene por objeto la Política Nacional de la Quinua, un instrumento de cobertura nacional  cuyo objetivo general consiste en promover, fomentar e implementar el desarrollo sostenible y sustentable del complejo productivo de la quinua, articulando a los actores productivos, para conformar entramados productivos integrados, articulados y diversificados, con la participación de los actores en procesos de producción, beneficiado, transformación e industrialización y comercialización, todo ello para alcanzar la seguridad alimentaria con soberanía nacional. El espíritu de la Política Nacional de la Quinua alienta un proceso de cambio para transitar de un modelo neoliberal de desarrollo hacia otro que incluya al conjunto de los actores rurales favoreciendo la mejora de sus sistemas de la producción de alimentos, en el contexto de una economía rural más diversificada, y una sociedad rural más democrática participativa e igualitaria.  El instrumento prioriza las siguientes políticas: 1) Política de Innovación, Desarrollo Tecnológico y Transferencia de Tecnología; 2) Política de Preservación y Uso Sostenible de Recursos Naturales y Medio Ambiente; 3) Política de Comercio Interno y Externo; 4) Política Crediticia y Financiera; 5) Política de Fortalecimiento Institucional Público, Privado y Comunitario; 6) Política de Infraestructura Productiva y de Servicios. Cada una de ellas se encuentra sistematizada en una matriz que indica las acciones estratégicas, el ámbito territorial, las entidades responsables, los ejecutores y participantes, la fuente de financiamiento, así como el período de ejecución a corto, mediano y largo plazo.

Policy: Política Nacional de Desarrollo Rural Integral.
Policy_Content: El presente documento, de carácter multisectorial y cobertura nacional, contiene la Política Nacional de Desarrollo Rural Integral, cuyo objetivo general consiste en lograr un avance progresivo y permanente en la calidad de vida de los habitantes de los territorios rurales, a través del acceso equitativo y uso sostenible de los recursos productivos, medios de producción, bienes naturales y servicios ambientales, para alcanzar el desarrollo humano integral sostenible en el área rural. Se establecen los principios rectores, normas y criterios generales que regirán también la formulación y ejecución del Plan Nacional de Desarrollo Rural Integral y de los programas y proyectos correspondientes, con el propósito de alcanzar el desarrollo humano integral y  sostenible en el área rural. Para la implementación de la Política Nacional de Desarrollo Rural Integral se definen las siguientes Políticas Sectoriales y Líneas Estratégicas: Política Agraria; Política Agrícola, Pecuaria, Forestal e Hidrobiológica; Política Económica; Política Social; Política Laboral; Política de Participación Social y Desarrollo Político; Política de Reducción de Vulnerabilidad y Gestión de Riesgo; Política de Soberanía Alimentaria y Seguridad Alimentaria y Nutricional; Política Cultural; Política Socio-Ambiental.

Policy: Plan Nacional de Soberanía y Seguridad Alimentaria y Nutricional del Paraguay (PLANAL).
Policy_Content: El presente documento contiene el Plan Nacional de Soberanía y Seguridad Alimentaria y Nutricional del Paraguay (PLANAL), cuyo objetivo principal es el de erradicar la inseguridad alimentaria y pérdida de soberanía alimentaria, y sus consecuencias de hambre y desnutrición, en sectores vulnerables de la población, como así también reducir la incidencia de la malnutrición y de las carencias y enfermedades de base alimentaria. La elaboración del PLANAL encuentra fundamento en el primero de los Objetivos de Desarrollo del Milenio suscritos por el Estado Paraguayo, que plantea el compromiso de la reducción del hambre a la mitad. Cabe destacar que se prioriza la atención de la problemática de soberanía y seguridad alimentaria con énfasis en las poblaciones más necesitadas, tales como las familias campesinas, pueblos indígenas y población periurbana marginal.

Policy: Política de Seguridad y Soberanía Alimentaria y Nutricional desde el Sector Público Agropecuario y Rural.
Policy_Content: El presente documento contiene la Política de Seguridad y Soberanía Alimentaria y Nutricional desde el Sector Público Agropecuario y Rural, un instrumento de alcance nacional cuyo objetivo es garantizar a los nicaragüenses disponibilidad y acceso a suministros estables de alimentos inocuos, nutritivos, pertinentes culturalmente, preferiblemente producidos en el país, que les permita tener una vida saludable y digna. La Política está basada en el derecho de todos los ciudadanos nicaragüenses de contar con una alimentación adecuada, y en la soberanía alimentaria, definida como el derecho a definir las propias políticas y estrategias sustentables de producción, distribución y consumo de alimentos, que garanticen el derecho a la alimentación a toda la población, con preferencia hacia la valorización y el consumo de productos nacionales. La política prioriza a los siguientes cuatro grupos como población objetivo: a) Micro, Pequeños y Medianos productores agropecuarios y forestales descapitalizados, comunidades indígenas y étnicas localizados en las áreas geográficas de mayor concentración de pobreza, desnutrición crónica y vulnerabilidad; b) productores capitalizados vinculados a actividades agropecuarias, forestales, apicultura, acuícolas y agroindustriales; c) grandes productores con tierras ociosas y baja productividad; d) población urbana y rural que esté en condiciones de inseguridad alimentaria y nutricional (afectados por fenómenos naturales, económicos, políticos o sociales).

Policy: II Plan de Acción Nacional para la Erradicación Gradual y Progresiva del Trabajo Infantil en Honduras 2008-2015.
Policy_Content: El propósito del II Plan de Acción Nacional frente al Trabajo Infantil es determinar qué intervenciones corresponde efectuar a las instituciones del Estado, con el concurso de la sociedad civil y de la cooperación internacional, para prevenir y erradicar el calificado “trabajo infantil a eliminar”, así como las medidas de coordinación, financieras, organizativas, de  planificación o de otro tipo para ordenar estas actuaciones, y que constituyan una respuesta efectiva. La intervención que contempla el II Plan de Acción para hacer frente a un problema multicausal y estructural, como es el trabajo infantil, arraigado en la tradición rural e íntimamente vinculado con una relación causa-efecto a la pobreza, se realiza mediante un abordaje coordinado por múltiples instituciones, en un contexto de escasez de recursos financieros y de debilidad en la coordinación institucional, en un esfuerzo sostenido por la integración de políticas existentes para optimizar el uso de los recursos asignados.

Policy: Regulation of the Law on Preventing the Fragmentation of Agricultural Lands and Creating Appropriate Pieces Due to Technical and Economic Matters.
Policy_Content: The Regulation, which consists of 15 articles, enforces the Law on Preventing the Fragmentation of Agricultural Lands and Creating Appropriate Pieces Due to Technical and Economic Matters. In particular, separation and partition of the farmland to the pieces smaller than determined technical and economical quorum is prohibited. The fragmentation of the national and public lands transferred for agricultural purpose is prohibited even after transfer. In order to encourage owners of farmlands to integrate their lands to reach the determined quorum, the Agriculture Ministry is responsible to provide them with new agricultural machineries, develop water and soil infrastructure as well as provide financial facilities and incentives.

Policy: Arrêté du Gouvernement flamand relatif à la lutte contre l'érosion.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté du Gouvernement flamand est relatif à la lutte contre l’érosion. L’article 1er établit que dans les limites des crédits budgétaires prévus à cet effet, le Ministre peut, conformément aux dispositions fixées dans le décret et dans le présent arrête, accorder une subvention aux communes en vue de l'application d'instruments et de mesures de lutte contre l'érosion à petite échelle. Les mesures de lutte contre l'érosion à petite échelle peuvent être exécutées tant sur le domaine public et privé des communes que sur les terrains de personnes morales de droit public, de personnes morales de droit privé et de personnes physiques. Le titre II concerne les instruments et mesures communales de lutte contre l'érosion et est répartis en 4 chapitres comme suit: Dispositions générales (Ier); Nature des instruments et mesures de lutte contre l'érosion et fixation de la subvention (II); La procédure (III); Paiement de la subvention (IV). Le texte comprend 24 articles répartis en 3 titres.

Policy_Content: This Act provides for the establishment of the Solomon Islands Maritime Safety Administration. The Administration shall be responsible for administering, applying and enforcing the Shipping Act 1998, and any other law applying to the maritime sector in Solomon Islands, unless otherwise provided for. References to the “Marine Division” or the “Marine Department” in the Shipping Act 1998, and in any other law, shall be deemed to be references to the Administration, and the Administration is empowered accordingly. The Administration shall, among other things, inspect, survey and register vessels. It may delegate functions relating to marine pollution prevention and response in port areas to the Ports Authority. The Act further provides, among other things, for the implementation of franchise shipping schemes and the management of maritime infrastructure and defines the functions of the Administration and the Minister in relation to international agreements. It also states the guidance principles for the Administration, which includes the “polluter pays” principle and the precautionary principle.
Subject: Fisheries, Sea, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Least Developed Countries, Melanesia, Oceania, Small Island Developing States, South Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Act commences on a date appointed by the Minister, by Notice in the Gazette.

Policy: Valuers Act 2009 (No. 4 of 2009).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the public control on land valuers and their practice and for this purpose establishes the Valuers Board and the Valuers Association of Solomon Islands. The Board shall, among other things, formulate, monitor and review policies relating to the practice of land valuation, register land valuers and regulate and control the practice of registered valuers. The Board may request the Minister to establish a valuers disciplinary committee to which complaints lodged to the Board shall be referred. Appeal against decisions of the Board may be had with the Minister. The Valuers Association of Solomon Islands is established as a body corporate. It shall, among other things, license land valuers.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Least Developed Countries, Melanesia, Oceania, Small Island Developing States, South Pacific

Policy: Law No. 151 “General technical regulation for ensuring ecological safety”.
Policy_Content: This Law shall have as its purpose environmental protection and establishes general requirements for ensuring ecological safety in the process of projecting and realization of economic and other activities related to the processes of manufacturing, storage, transportation and recycling of produce. The Act consists of 5 Sections divided into 25 articles: (1) general provisions; (2) basic provisions for ensuring ecological safety; (3) ecological safety requirements set for economic and other activities; (4) environmental audit; and (5) conclusive and transitional provisions. Technical regulation shall be based on the following principles: (a) mandatory environmental audit and environmental impact assessment (EIA) of the projected economic activities; (b) limitation of environmental impact regulated by ecological safety requirements and environmental standards; (c) reduction of negative environmental impact of production processes; (d) prohibition of economic activities and production processes with unpredictable environmental impact; (e) priority of ecosystem conservation; and (f) transparency.
Subject: Livestock, Environment gen., Fisheries

Policy: Décret concernant le sous-sol profond (1).
Policy_Content: Le présen décret concerne le sous-sol profond. Notamment, l’article 3 établit que les hydrocarbures naturellement présents dans le sous-sol profond sont la propriété de la Région flamande. La propriété des hydrocarbures extraits en faisant usage d'un permis d'extraction passe, du fait de cette extraction, au titulaire du permis, à condition toutefois qu'une indemnisation soit payée à la Région flamande, conformément au chapitre II, division II. La propriété des hydrocarbures extraits du sous-sol comme échantillons ou épreuves de formation en faisant usage d'un permis de recherche d'hydrocarbures passe au titulaire du permis sans qu'une indemnisation doive être payée à la Région flamande. Le texte comprend 77 articles répartis en 6 chapitres comme suit: Dispositions générales (Ier); La prospection et l'exploitation d'hydrocarbures (II); Le stockage géologique du dioxyde de carbone (III); Maintien (IV); Dispositions modificatives (V); Dispositions finales (VI).

Policy: Arrêté du Gouvernement flamand relatif à la lutte contre l'érosion.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté du Gouvernement flamand est relatif à la lutte contre l’érosion. L’article 1er établit que dans les limites des crédits budgétaires prévus à cet effet, le Ministre peut, conformément aux dispositions fixées dans le décret et dans le présent arrête, accorder une subvention aux communes en vue de l'application d'instruments et de mesures de lutte contre l'érosion à petite échelle. Les mesures de lutte contre l'érosion à petite échelle peuvent être exécutées tant sur le domaine public et privé des communes que sur les terrains de personnes morales de droit public, de personnes morales de droit privé et de personnes physiques. Le titre II concerne les instruments et mesures communales de lutte contre l'érosion et est répartis en 4 chapitres comme suit: Dispositions générales (Ier); Nature des instruments et mesures de lutte contre l'érosion et fixation de la subvention (II); La procédure (III); Paiement de la subvention (IV). Le texte comprend 24 articles répartis en 3 titres.
