Policy: Governmental Order No. 631-r validating the List of living and traditional economic activities of indigenous peoples of the Russian Federation.
Policy_Content: This Governmental Order validates the List of places of traditional residence of indigenous peoples of the Russian Federation and the List of types of traditional economic activities of indigenous peoples of the Russian Federation. The List of traditional economic activities of indigenous peoples of the Russian Federation include: (a) livestock breeding, including nomadic (reindeer, horse, yak breeding, sheep breeding); (b) processing of livestock products, including collection, procurement and dressing of skins, wool, hair, ossified horns, hooves, antlers, bones, endocrine glands, meat, offal; (c) dog breeding (breeding of reindeer herding, sled and hunting dogs); (d) breeding of wild fauna species, processing and sale of products of fur farming; (e) horticulture, beekeeping; (f) fishing (including marine hunting) and trade of aquatic biological resources; (g) commercial hunting, processing and trade of hunting of wildlife products; (h) agriculture (horticulture), as well as breeding and processing of medicinal plants; (i) harvesting of timber and non-timber forest resources for own needs; (j) collection (procurement, processing and trade of alimentary forest resources, collection of medicinal plants); (k) extraction and processing of common widespread minerals for their own needs; (l) arts and crafts (blacksmith and iron craft, making utensils, implements, boats, sleds, other traditional means of transportation, musical instruments, birch bark products, stuffed animals and birds, fur souvenirs, deer and game animals and birds, other materials, weaving from herbs and other plants, knitting of nets, bone carving, wood carving, sewing national dress and other types of crafts and crafts related to processing of fur, leather, bone and other materials); and (m) construction of national traditional dwellings and others buildings necessary for the implementation of traditional economic activities.

Policy: Regulation on the report on the impact of the planned activity on the environment.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Government of the Republic of Slovenia, which is composed of 23 articles, sets out the detailed contents of the report on the impact of the planned activity on the environment specified in accordance with the legislation of the European Community. These provisions apply to all reports on the effects of planned activity on the environment which are made for procedures for which it is necessary to carry out an environmental impact assessment (EIA) and obtain environmental approval. The report must include, in particular, the information on: (1) the nature and characteristics of the intervention, which is the subject of an environmental impact assessment; (2) main alternative solutions and the reasons for the selection of submitted solutions; (3) existing state of the environment in which the intervention takes place or parts of the environment where the intervention would have a significant effect; (4) possible effects of intervention on the environment or its components and human health; (5) measures to prevent, reduce or eliminate the negative effects on the environment and human health and the main alternatives that were considered for these measures.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Regional Law No. 21-RZ "On cultural heritage".
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations in the sphere of conservation, management , promotion and state protection of the objects of cultural heritage and is aimed at ensuring constitutional right of citizens related to access to cultural heritage. Objects of cultural heritage shall be considered immovable property and shall include natural landscapes, recreational urban forests and parks. Land within the boundaries of territories of cultural heritage recorded in the public register of the objects of cultural heritage shall be considered land of historical and cultural heritage.

Policy: Federal Law No. 5 of the year 2009 concerning the organic inputs and products.
Policy_Content: This law, consisting of 16 articles, aims at organizing production, manufacture, preparation, circulation, import and export of organic inputs and products. The law also applies to organic production units and certifiers. The Ministry of Environment and Water establishes standards, specifications, conditions and measures for the analysis of organic inputs and products. It regulates as well import, export, registration, labels and data of the special card for them. These informations will be included in the Regulation of this Law. The Minister shall issue a written permission for the use of input and organic products present in the lists of prohibited substances. He also has the right to prohibit, permanently or temporarily, production, manufacture, export, import, circulation of any organic input or product, either agricultural or animal. The Law provides sanctions for those who violate its provisions.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Food & nutrition, Fisheries, Cultivated plants

The Kyoto Protocol implements the objective of the UNFCCC to fight global warming by reducing greenhouse gas concentrations in the atmosphere to a level that would prevent dangerous anthropogenic interference with the climate system.

Policy: Fluorinated Greenhouse Gases Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2009 (S.R. No. 184 of 2009).
Policy_Content: These Regulations continue to give effect to Regulation (EC) No 842/2006 of the European Parliament and of the Council on certain fluorinated greenhouse gases and other Community legislation in this field. The Regulations make provision with respect to the importation, placing on the market and use of such gases and contain provisions which create offences for breaches of the provisions of the Council Regulation. They also prescribe the qualifications which are required in order to carry out certain work involving equipment containing fluorinated greenhouse gases or the recovery of such gases. It is an offence to carry out such work without the required qualification. The Regulations define the “competent authority” and the “enforcing authority” for purposes of these Regulations and the Council Regulation.

Policy: Regional Law No. 30-RZ “On the modalities of concession of subsoil for extraction of minerals from deposits of common minerals”.

Policy: Directive 2009/41/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on the contained use of genetically modified micro-organisms.
Policy_Content: This Directive lays down common measures for the contained use of genetically modified micro-organisms (GMMs) with a view to protecting human health and the environment. Member States must ensure that all appropriate measure are taken to avoid adverse effects on human health and the environment which might arise from the contained use of GMMs. These provisions do not apply to the storage, culture, transport, destruction, disposal or use of GMMs which havebeen placed on the market in accordance with Directive 2001/18/EC or pursuant to other Community legislation which provides for a specific environmental risk assessment similar to that laid down in that Directive, provided that the contained use is in accordance with the conditions, if any, of the consent for placing on the market.

Policy: Resolution CONAMA No. 411 providing for inspection procedures related to industries that consume or process natural forest products and by-products, as well as setting the related standards and volume yield coefficients, including vegetal coal and saw mill wastes.
Policy_Content: This Resolution, consisting of 13 articles and seven Annexes, provides for the maximum limits for the emission of pollutants in the air for processes of external combustion of fixed sources of pollution. Considering the need of establishing patterns for forest products and by-products that enables the integration of electronic control systems, provided for in the Resolution CONAMA No. 379 of 19 October 2006, it establishes the National emission standards by new fixed external combustion sources with nominal power of up to 70 MW and above. New pollution sources are those belonging to enterprises that will apply for licenses from the competent environmental organs after the date of publication of this Resolution. A external combustion process in point sources comprehends all burning of combustible substances through the following machines: boilers, vapor generators, plants for the generation of electric energy, ovens, furnaces, greenhouses and dryers for the generation and use of thermic energy, incinerators and gasifiers.

Policy: State Treaty between the State of Lower Saxony and the Free Hanseatic City Bremen on cross-border land-use planning and land development.
Policy_Content: The present State Treaty between the State of Lower Saxony and the Free Hanseatic City of Bremen establishes that they shall cooperate in all matters concerning cross-border land-use planning and land development. Furthermore, they shall work together with the competent authorities to obtain an adequate implementation of the Regional Land Use Planning Programme. Policy: Regulation No. P.30/Menhut-II/2009 on the implementation procedures of reducing emissions from deforestation and forest degradation (REDD).
Policy_Content: This Regulation sets rules for the implementation of procedures for the reduction of emission caused by deforestation and forest degradation (REDD) by The Ministry of Forestry’s stipulation of policies aiming to enhance sustainable forest management activities in accordance to REDD. The objective of this Regulation is to reduce the occurrence of deforestation and forest degradation in order to achieve sustainable  forest management and to increase the welfare of the people. REDD provisions may be implemented in areas listed under article 3. The proponents of REDD shall submit a proposal to the Minister of Forestry for such activities, and the Minister shall appoint the REDD Commission in order to assess and eventual approval of such proposals (implementation shall be valid for a maximum of 30 years). Guidelines for REDD proposal assessments are listed in Appendix 4 of this document. If and when all requirements are fulfilled (within a  maximum of 30 working days after the report of the verification results from the Independent Appraisal Institution, the REDD  Commission shall issue the Carbon Emission Reduction Certificate. Prior to the decision of parties to the United Nations Convention on Climate Change on the REDD implementation mechanism at international level, the REDD Commission shall request the National Accreditation Committee (KAN) to conduct the accreditation of the Independent Appraisal Institution (art. 18) and the financial distribution of state revenue from the implementation of REDD shall be regulated with separate rules and regulation (art. 20). Rights and obligations of REDD are detailed under article 14.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen., Forestry
Keyword: Climate change,Emissions,Air quality/air pollution,Institution,Environmental standards,Pollution control,Protection forest,Afforestation/reforestation,Inspection,Forest management/forest conservation
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Indian Ocean, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: Regulation amending the Regulation on Forestation.
Policy_Content: This Regulation sets forth principles on forestation, rehabilitation, erosion prevention,  pasture improvement and seed production. It lays down some amendments to the Regulation on forestation, particularly as regards the definitions laid down therein. Private forestation activities, private erosion controlling activities and private rehabilitation activities within the State forests are covered by these provisions. Individuals and companies wishing to be engaged in private forestation, private erosion controlling and private rehabilitation efforts in State forests must apply to the local offices under the Ministry. Any construction on such areas is restricted and subject to prior permission by the Ministry. Further provisions deal with special loans.

Policy: Decree No. 562 of the Council of Ministers validating Regulation on state registration of the sources of ionizing radiation.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes the modalities of state registration of the sources of ionizing radiation and granting access to information related thereto. Department of nuclear and radiation safety within the Ministry of Emergency Situations shall be authorized to carry out state registration of the sources of ionizing radiation. Sources of ionizing radiation pertaining to the property of the Republic of Belarus shall be subject to compulsory registration free of charge. This Decree shall not be applicable to radioactive waste, materials and substances contaminated by radionuclides of Chernobyl origin. The objectives of state registration shall be listing of the sources of ionizing radiation and evaluation of the state of radiation safety.

Policy: Loi nº 09-005 portant Code minier.
Policy_Content: La Communauté économie et monétaire de l’Afrique centrale (CEMAC) a décidé d’uniformiser le code minier dans les pays membres (Cameroun, Congo, Gabon, République centrafricaine (RCA), Tchad) pour la transparence et la bonne gouvernance dans le secteur des industries extractives. Le nouveau Code minier de 2009i a pour objet de régir les activités minières en vue de promouvoir les investissements dans le secteur minier. Elle s'applique à la reconnaissance, à la prospection, a la recherche et a l’exploitation de gîtes de substances minérales, ainsi que leur possession, leur transport, leur traitement et leur commercialisation. L'exploitation artisanale des substances minérales ainsi que la commercialisation de celles-ci sont également régies par les dispositions de la présente loi. La loi comporte des corrections des anciennes dispositions minières, portant notamment sur la réduction de la durée de détention des titres miniers (Le permis de recherche est valable pour trois ans, renouvelable deux fois par période consécutive de trois ans, le permis d'exploitation industrielle est valable pour une durée de vingt cinq ans, renouvelable par période consécutive de cinq ans jusqu'a épuisement du gisement), sur l'introduction de certains prélèvements nouveaux, et sur l'institutionnalisation du contrat de partage de production et de la création des organes de suivi et contrôle de gestion.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Act on organic farming.

Policy: Resolution CEMA No. 069 approving the Regulation of the State Environmental Council (CEMA).
Policy_Content: This Decree approves in Annex the Regulation of the State Environmental Council (CEMA). This Regulation, consisting of 77 articles divided into nine Chapters, establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned Council, as a higher body of collegiate, advisory, normative and deliberative character, established for the purpose of formulating the State Environmental Policy. CEMA will work in accordance with the values ​​and principles of the State of Paraná. The following Permanent Thematic Committees are established, with the respective competencies: Biodiversity, Biomes and Environmental Education: a) biodiversity protection standards; b) patterns of protection of genetic heritage; c) patrimonial protection standards; d) patterns of protection of speleological heritage; e) creation and implementation of public or private protected areas; f) integrated management of ecological coastal and marine environments; g) permanent protection areas; h) State System of Conservation Units; i) State System for Protection of Native Fauna - SISFAUNA; j) guidelines for the elaboration and implementation of state environmental education policies and programmes, etc.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Decreto Nº 1.397/09 - Por el cual se establecen medidas sanitarias para el uso adecuado de plaguicidas en la producción agropecuaria, con vistas a la protección de la salud de las personas, así como de los alimentos y del ambiente.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto establece las medidas que deben adoptarse para el uso adecuado de los plaguicidas en la producción agropecuaria, con el objeto de garantizar la protección de la salud humana y del medio ambiente y la seguridad de los alimentos. Las medidas mencionadas incluyen las siguientes: a) franja de bosque protector; b) barreras vivas; c) franja de protección para aplicación terrestre; d) franja de protección para aplicación aérea. Además, el Decreto indica las precacuciones que deben adoptarse para la pulverización aérea y terrestre.

The aforesaid paid services shall be rendered in strict observance of national forest legislation and legislation on protected areas. The following paid services can be rendered to natural and legal persons: (a) growing planting materials and collection of forest seeds; (b) planting of protection belts, greenery; (c) training; (d) trade of timber, including fuelwood; and (e) secondary forest management.

Policy: Regional Legislative Decree No. 19/2017/M amending the legal regime for exploitation and functioning of touristic infrastructure.
Policy_Content: This Regional Legislative Decree amends and republishes the legal regime for exploitation and functioning of touristic infrastructure. Amendments deal with the establishment of a new regime for the procedure relating to the installation for tourism development and new typologies of tourism enterprises. With regard to the procedure for the use of the tourism enterprise, a tacit mechanism was created, based on the regular submission of the application for authorization of tourism purposes. In the classification process, the possibility of requirements for the category being dispensed was enshrined. The fees due for conducting mandatory classification audits were eliminated, as well as the Declaration of Interest for Tourism.

Policy_Content: This Regional Legislative Decree, consisting of 23 articles adapts to the Autonomous Region of Madeira Decree-Law no. 39/2008 establishing the legal regime for exploitation and functioning of touristic infrastructure. The adaptations introduced by this Legislative Decree applies to all tourism enterprises and local accommodation establishments that are located and carry out their activity in the Autonomous Region of Madeira. The competences of the regime in adaptation to 'Turismo de Portugal, IP', its president and the Food and Economic Security Authority are carried out within the Autonomous Region of Madeira by the Regional Directorate for Tourism in relation to all tourism enterprises. The establishment of the maximum capacity of accommodation including within rural areas referred to in Article 18 (3) (a) and (b) of the diploma in adaptation is also a responsibility of the Regional Directorate for Tourism. The responsibilities attributed to the Institute of Nature Conservation and Biodiversity, I. P., are exercised, in the Autonomous Region of Madeira, by the government department responsible for the environment.

Policy: Decision No. 406/2009/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on the effort of Member States to reduce their greenhouse gas emissions to meet the Community’s greenhouse gas emission reduction commitments up to 2020.
Policy_Content: This Decision lays down provisions governing the minimum contribution of European Community Member States to meet the greenhouse gas emission reduction commitment of the European Community for the period from 2013 to 2020. It requires Member States to limit its greenhouse gas emissions within 2020 at least by the percentage set for that Member State in Annex II to this Decision.

Policy: Directive 2009/16/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on port State control.
Policy_Content: This Directive implements within the European Community a port State control system. It sets out common criteria for control of ships by the port State and lays down harmonized procedures on inspection and detention. The aim is to increase compliance with international and relevant European Union legislation on maritime safety, maritime security and protection of the marine environment.
Subject: Environment gen., Sea

Policy: Directive 2009/18/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council establishing the fundamental principles governing the investigation of accidents in the maritime transport sector and amending Council Directive 1999/35/EC and Directive 2002/59/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Directive is to improve maritime safety and the prevention of pollution by ships, and so reduce the risk of future marine casualties. To this end, it lays down provisions for facilitating the expeditious holding of safety investigations and proper analysis of marine casualties and incidents in order to determine their causes, and ensuring the timely and accurate reporting of safety investigations and proposals for remedial action. These provisions apply to marine casualties and incidents that (i) involve ships flying the flag of European Community Member States, and (ii) occur within Member States' territorial sea. The Directive provides for the establishment of the European Marine Casualty Information Platform, where data on marine casualties and incidents shall be stored and analysed by means of a European electronic database.
Subject: Sea, Environment gen.

Policy: Directive 2009/17/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council amending Directive 2002/59/EC establishing a Community vessel traffic monitoring and information system.
Policy_Content: This Directive lays down some amendments and addenda to Directive 2002/59/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council establishing a Community vessel traffic monitoring and information system. In particular, it lays down new provisions concerning the use of automatic identification systems by fishing vessels, the use of systems for the long-range identification and tracking of ships and measures to be implemented in the event of risks posed by the presence of ice. Furthermore, the Directive provides for the establishment of maritime information management systems, at national and local level, to process the information referred to in these provisions.
Subject: Sea, Environment gen.

Policy: Regulation (EC) No. 391/2009 of the European Parliament and of the Council on common rules and standards for ship inspection and survey organisations.
Policy_Content: This Regulation sets out measures to be followed by organizations entrusted with the inspection, survey and certification of ships for compliance with the international conventions on safety at sea and prevention of marine pollution, namely the International Convention for the Safety of Life at Sea of 1 November 1974 (SOLAS 74) and the International Convention for the Prevention of Pollution from Ships of 2 November 1973 (MARPOL). The Annex specifies the requirements to be met by the organizations above-mentioned in order to enjoy or continue to enjoy European Community recognition.
Subject: Sea, Environment gen.

Policy: Directive 2009/21/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on compliance with flag State requirements.
Policy_Content: This Directive lays down provisions aimed at enhancing safety and preventing pollution from ships flying the flag of a Member State. It sets out rules to ensure that European Community Member States effectively and consistently discharge their obligations as flag States.
Subject: Sea, Environment gen.

Policy: Directive 2009/28/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on the promotion of the use of energy from renewable sources and amending and subsequently repealing Directives 2001/77/EC and 2003/30/EC.
Policy_Content: This Directive sets out a common framework for the promotion of energy from renewable sources, which include wind, solar, aerothermal, geothermal, hydrothermal and ocean energy, hydropower, biomass, landfill gas, sewage treatment plant gas and biogases. In particular, these provisions establish mandatory national targets for the overall share of energy from renewable sources in gross final consumption of energy and for the share of energy from renewable sources in transport. Furhermore, the Directive lays down rules relating to statistical transfers and joint projects between European Community Member States, joint projects with third countries, guarantees of origin, administrative procedures, information and training, and access to the electricity grid for energy from renewable sources. The Directive also establishes sustainability criteria for biofuels and bioliquids.
Subject: Energy, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Directive 2009/29/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council amending Directive 2003/87/EC so as to improve and extend the greenhouse gas emission allowance trading scheme of the Community.
Policy_Content: This Directive lays down amendments and addenda to Directive 2003/87/EC, which establishes a scheme for greenhouse gas emission allowance trading within the European Community. The amendments provide for the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions to be increased so as to contribute to the levels of reductions that are considered scientifically necessary to avoid dangerous climate change. Furthermore, these provisions aim at assessing and implementing a stricter European Community reduction commitment exceeding 20 percent. The amendments also deal with greenhouse gas emissions permits, Community-wide quantity of allowances, montoring and reporting of emissions.

Policy: Directive 2009/30/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council amending Directive 98/70/EC as regards the specification of petrol, diesel and gas-oil and introducing a mechanism to monitor and reduce greenhouse gas emissions and amending Council Directive 1999/32/EC as regards the specification of fuel used by inland waterway vessels and repealing Directive 93/12/EEC.
Policy_Content: This Directive updates the provisions under Directive 98/70/EC concerning the quality of petrol and diesel fuels. Firstly it widens the application scope of that Directive, which shall include: (a) technical specifications on health and environmental grounds for fuels to be used with positive ignition and compression-ignition engines, taking account of the technical requirements of those engines; and (b) a target for the reduction of life cycle greenhouse gas emissions. These specifications and target shall apply to road vehicles and non-road mobile machinery (including inland waterway vessels when not at sea), agricultural and forestry tractors, as well as recreational craft when not at sea. Further amendments concern sustainability criteria for diesel fuels and greenhouse gas emissions reductions.

Policy: Regulation (EC) No 401/2009 of the European Parliament and of the Council on the European Environment Agency and the European Environment Information and Observation Network.
Policy_Content: This Regulation provides for the European Environment Agency and setting up of a European Environment Information and Observation Network to ensure environmental protection and improvement in accordance with the Treaty. The Agency and the European Environment Information and Observation Network shall provide objective, reliable and comparable information and the necessary technical and scientific support to the Community and the Member States for the protection of environment. The priorities of the European Environment Agency are determined in Article 3, as (I) air quality and atmospheric emissions; (II) water quality, pollutants and water resources; (III) the state of the soil, of the fauna and flora, and of biotopes; (IV) land use and natural resources; (V) waste management; (VI) noise emissions; (VII) chemical substances which are hazardous for the environment; and (VIII) coastal and marine protection.

Policy: Sectional Titles Act, 2009 (Act No. 2 of 2009).
Policy_Content: This Act makes provision for ownership rights in buildings which are divided in sections and in part owned in common ownership. It defines ownership and real rights in or over parts of buildings and land and provides for registration of title to ownership or other real rights in or over such parts. A developer who intends to establish a development scheme must follow procedures as set out in this Act. Owners of sections are jointly owners of the common property in undivided shares proportionate to the participation quotas of their respective sections as specified on the relevant sectional plan. Policy: Loi relative à la responsabilité environnementale en ce qui concerne la prévention et la réparation des dommages environnementaux.
Policy_Content: La présente loi a pour objet d’établir un cadre de responsabilité environnementale fondé sur le principe du pollueur-payeur, en vue de prévenir et de réparer les dommages environnementaux. La présente loi s’applique aux: a) dommages causés à l’environnement par l’une des activités professionnelles énumérées à l’annexe III, et à la menace imminente de tels dommages découlant de l’une de ces activités; b) dommages causés aux espèces et habitats naturels protégés par l’une des activités professionnelles autres que celles énumérées à l’annexe III, et à la menace imminente de tels dommages découlant de l’une de ces activités, lorsque l’exploitant a commis une faute ou une négligence. Le texte – comprenant 15 articles – traite les aspects suivants: action de prévention, action de réparation, définition des mesures de réparation,  coûts liés à la prévention et à la réparation, demande d’action, recours, coopération entre Etats membres et entrée en vigueur et dispositions transitoires. Policy: Regional Law No. 1082-01-ZMO “On agricultural development.”
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations arising between citizens and legal entities recognized as agricultural commodity producers on the basis of this Regional Law, enterprises providing services for agriculture, food manufacturing and processing industry, performing transportation, procurement, storage of agricultural commodities and supply thereof to the consumer, as well as between other citizens, legal persons, regional public authorities in the field of agricultural development. Regional agricultural policy is an integral part of the regional socio-economic policy aimed at sustainable development of agriculture and rural areas in the region. Sustainable development of rural areas shall be intended stable social and economic development thereof, increase in volume of agricultural production, increasing efficiency of agriculture, achieving full employment of the rural population and raising living standard thereof, as well as rational use of land. Regional agricultural policy shall be based on the following principles: (a) availability and targeting of state support of agricultural producers, as well as organizations and individual entrepreneurs engaged in primary and (or) subsequent (industrial) processing of agricultural commodities, scientific organizations, professional training organizations, educational institutions of higher education, which in the process of scientific, research and technical and (or) educational activities carry out manufacturing of agricultural commodities, primary and subsequent (industrial) processing thereof in accordance with the list approved by the Government of the Russian Federation; (b)  availability of information on the state of regional agricultural policy; (c) uniformity of the market for agricultural commodities, raw materials and food ensuring equal competitive conditions on market; (d) the sequence of the implementation of measures of regional agricultural policy and its sustainable development; and (e) participation of unions (associations) of agricultural producers in the formation and implementation of the regional agrarian policy.

Policy: Law No. 8 of 2009 on smoking and tobacco fighting.
Policy_Content: This Law is composed of 23 articles. Article 1 gives terms and definitions. Article 2 decrees the ban on the cultivation, manufacturing and reproduction of all types of tobacco in the Kingdom of Bahrain. Article 3 prohibits the importation and introduction of all types of tobacco as well as automatic distributors of tobacco in the Kingdom of Bahrain. Article 4 decrees no smoking areas all public utilities and services, means of transportation, ports and airports, ministries, schools, universities, institutions, mosques, industries, markets, shops, cooperatives, clubs, restaurants, hotels, cinemas, barber shops, lifts, banks and the like. Article 5 prohibits the sale of tobacco and cigarettes to adolescents and to underage. Articles 6 to 8 prohibit advertising, promotion and sponsorship of tobacco. Article 11 decrees the ban on the importation of any type of herbs or herbal-stuffs to be used as alternative for tobacco. Articles 16 and 17 decree the establishment of the National Committee for Fighting Smoking and Tobacco Products and define its competencies.  Article 20 contains offences and penalties.

Policy: Order No. 87 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on calculation of damages caused to waterbodies by the infringement of water legislation.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the modalities of calculation of damages caused to waterbodies by the infringement of water legislation, including accidental oil spills, and, in particular, for the calculation of damages that have caused water pollution, clogging or exhaustion of water. It shall be applicable to the following main damages: (a) water pollution by hazardous substances (pollutants) contained in effluent waste water, marine oil pollution from ships; (b) water pollution caused by accidental oil spill; (c) discharge of effluent waste water from ships; (d) clogging of water area by industrial and consumer waste, including clogging by abandoned and sunken vessels; and (e) clogging of water area by prohibited timber floating and timber rafting without ship traction. Calculation of damages shall be based upon compensation principle with indemnification of damages to the full extent and payment for the mitigation of the consequences of the offence. The Order contains calculation formula.

Policy: Law No. 14.675 establishing the Environmental Code within the State of Santa Catarina.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 296 articles divided into seven Titles, establishes the Basic Environmental Legislation within the State of Santa Catarina. The objectives of the State Environmental Policy are: protect and improve the quality of the environment for present and future generations; recover degraded areas; ensure the adequate and sustainable use of environmental resources; generate social and economic benefits; promote cooperation between municipalities and the adoption of joint solutions; protect and recover ecological processes aimed at the reproduction and maintenance of biodiversity; establish criteria and standards of environmental quality and norms regarding the use and management of environmental resources; promote dissemination and training programmes for the use and management of environmental resources in rural properties. This Code also creates competent authorities entitled to carry out research and inspection related to this sector. It does not apply for any activity related to: environmental education; water resources; and water sanitation. It is divided as follows: General provisions (Title I); State Environmental Policy (Title II); Concepts and definitions (Title III); State Policy instruments (Title IV); Natural resources management (Title V); Activities potentially causing environmental degradation (Title VI); Final provisions (Title VII).

Policy: Environmental Damage (Prevention and Remediation) (Wales) Regulations 2009 (W.S.I. No. 995 (W.81)).
Policy_Content: These Regulations apply to damage to protected species, natural habitats, sites of special scientific interest, water and land. They implement Directive 2004/35/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on environmental liability with regard to the prevention and remedying of environmental damage and provide that, for certain economic activities, where there is an imminent risk of environmental damage, the operator must take steps to prevent it, and if it has occurred must prevent further damage. Where damage has occurred the enforcing authority must assess the damage and identify remedial measures. It must then serve a remediation notice on the responsible operator specifying what remediation is required. The Regulations also provide with respect to other matters of enforcement and define offences.

Policy: Plan Nacional de Seguridad Alimentaria y Nutrición 2009-2015.
Policy_Content: El presente documento establece el Plan Nacional de Seguridad Alimentaria y Nutrición (Plan SAN), un instrumento multisectorial de alcance nacional y relativo al período 2009-2015, que forma parte de las acciones que el Estado panameño toma para garantizar el derecho a la alimentación a la población vulnerable de forma efectiva y sostenible. Con el Plan SAN se desea lograr que en el año 2015 la población panameña que se encuentra en situación de inseguridad alimentaria y nutricional disponga, acceda y consuma alimentos en suficiente cantidad, variedad, calidad e inocuidad, bajo unas condiciones de salud y de saneamiento básico en forma sostenible para alcanzar el desarrollo humano mediante el compromiso y la participación del gobierno, los organismos internacionales, los gremios y la sociedad. La población objetivo del Plan SAN es la que presenta mayores niveles de vulnerabilidad, la que se encuentra en situación de inseguridad alimentaria y nutricional, las mujeres embarazadas y madres lactantes, los niños menores de tres años y las familias expuestas a desnutrición crónica en comunidades y municipios prioritarios.

Policy: Note de Politique Agricole.
Policy_Content: La Note de Politique Agricole est un document qui constitue la base de la planification des actions qui concourent au développement du secteur agricole en République Démocratique du Congo. Policy: Water Supply and Sanitation Policy.
Policy_Content: The Water Supply and Sanitation Policy is a national policy whose main objective is to provide guidance and direction in institutional, economic and legal reforms that will lead to improved water governance at national, local and community levels, and improved access to safe water supply and adequate sanitation, in an affordable, sustainable and equitable manner, to all the peoples of Liberia. In conformity with the Government’s Poverty Reduction Strategy (PRS) 2008 – 2011 and the National Integrated Water Resources Management Policy, Liberia’s vision of the Water Supply and Sanitation Policy shall be using clean water supply and safe sanitation as a vehicle for reducing the water supply and sanitation related disease burden, increasing productivity, promoting human welfare and setting the nation on a path towards longterm sustainable growth, development, and poverty reduction.

Policy: Law No. 166 “On agricultural development.”
Policy_Content: This Law establishes legal relations between citizens, legal persons, state executive bodies and local self-government for the development of agrofood sector of the national economy. It regulates the relations between rural producers of agricultural commodities, state bodies and local self-government directed at implementation of state policy in the sphere of agricultural development and production of agricultural commodities with a view of provision of the population with food. The scope of this Law shall be: (a) to ensure food security; (b) to ensure stable development and functioning of agro-industrial sector; and (c) creation of favourable conditions for rural livelihoods. Achievement of the aforesaid objectives shall be ensured by: (a) crediting of agro-industrial complex; (b) export regulation in the agro-industrial sector; (c) ensuring veterinary, sanitary and phytosanitary safety; and (d) training of staff for agro-industrial sector. State regulation of agrofood markets shall be carried out by: (a) state purchasing and commodity interventions; and (b) protection of internal market.

Policy: Law No. HO-71-N “On beekeeping”.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates the relations in the sphere of beekeeping management intended for obtaining products of beekeeping, defines the legal basis for the activities related to breeding, care, the use of bee species, the preservation of honey bees and the veterinary service for beekeeping sector. Either natural or legal persons shall have the right to carry out beekeeping. Bee colonies shall be subject to registration. Apiaries shall be placed on land in conformity with veterinary procedures at a distance of no less than 0.5 km from healthcare, educational, cultural and other public institutions and organization in order to protect public health. In case of transfer of reproductive bees from one colony (apiary) to another they shall be kept in quarantine for at least one year. In case of ecological production of honey and other apiculture products they must certified by the authorized state body.

Policy: Land Acquisition Regulations, 2008.
Policy_Content: These Regulations establish the basis for assessing the market value of any land or the compensation for any injurious affection caused by the acquisition of land. Market Value should be assessed as follows: in case part of a land is acquired and when its value as a separate entity deems to realize a value proportionately lower than the Market Value of the main land the compensation should be proportionate to the value of the main land. When the date of intention to acquire was published, the building is used or is intended to be used for occupation and or business purposes, the difference between the cost of re-construction and the value of building, based for determination of Market Value under Section 1.1, should be paid as an additional compensation. Value based on development potential could be considered for paddy lands acquired where permission to fill such lands have been granted by the Agrarian Services Commissioner General. When an acquired building is occupied by a tenant/statutory tenant protected under the provisions of the Rent Act, No. 7 of 1972 (as amended thereafter) the compensation should be ascertained in proportion having regard to the provisions of Rent (Amendment) Act, No. 26 of 2006.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Regulation on Management of Protected Areas
Policy_Content: The Regulation sets provisions to create, regulate and manage protected areas in the country. This Regulation consists of 31 articles, divided into 6 Chapters: General Provisions (I); Administrative Procedures (II); Plans and Programs (III); Operations (IV); National System for Protected Areas (V); Observations (VI). This Regulation recognizes the protected areas as national heritage, which is forbidden to be sold or transferred to another person. The Central Department for Protected Areas is the authority responsible to: determine and categorize protected areas, with cooperation of Department of Environment; assign a chief of operation for each protected area; prepare development and maintenance plans for each protected area; arrange required budget; offer suggestion to Department of Environment. The Central Department for Protected Areas may assign an NGO as a chief of operation of a protected area. To create a new protected area, the Central Department for Protected Areas with cooperation of Department of Environment should submit their proposal to the Council of Ministers and the final decision will be made by the Council. Building any infrastructure in the protected areas only is permittable by permits issued by the Central Department for Protected Areas.

Policy: Decree No. 98 of the Cabinet of Ministers validating the Regulation on state registration and control over circulation of the sources on ionizing radiation.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes the modalities of state registration and control over circulation of the sources on ionizing radiation such as nuclear materials, radioactive substances, radioactive sources and radioactive waste. It shall be mandatory for all subjects dealing with extraction, manufacturing, processing, recycling, storage, transportation (including import and export), recovery and disposal thereof, as well as for authorized state institutions in the sphere of registration and control of the sources of ionizing radiation. The purposes of registration and control shall be: (a) determination of available sources of ionizing radiation; (b) prevention of losses, unauthorized use and theft sources of ionizing radiation; and (c) access to objective and reliable information on availability and movement of the sources of ionizing radiation. The main tasks of the system of state registration and control of the sources of ionizing radiation shall be: (a) formation of the national register of the sources of ionizing radiation; (b) identification of losses, unauthorized use and theft of the sources of ionizing radiation; and (c) exchange of information within the framework of international agreements concluded by the Republic of Uzbekistan.

Policy: Regional Law No. 108-Z “On Civic Chamber”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that Civic Chamber must ensure coordination between citizens, social associations, state bodies and local government, promotion of civil society institutions, and consideration of the interests of the population in the process of elaboration and realization of state policy, protection of rights and freedoms of citizens. Civic Chamber shall be set up to ensure open and transparent discussion of the most important problems of social development, promotion of civil society institutions and democratic principles of the functioning of state bodies. Policy: Ley de derechos y cultura indígena del Estado de Tabasco.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley, reglamentaria del artículo 2° de la Constitución Política del Estado Libre y Soberano de Tabasco en lo relativo a los derechos y cultura indígena, establece la obligación de los poderes del Estado y los Ayuntamientos o Concejos Municipales, en sus relaciones con los pueblos y sus comunidades indígenas, con el propósito de elevar el bienestar social de sus integrantes, teniendo en cuenta la perspectiva de género. Cabe destacar el reconocimiento de los derechos relacionados con el territorio indígena, definido como la zona geográfica donde todo o parte de un pueblo indígena se asienta, y que cubre la totalidad del hábitat que ocupan o utilizan de alguna manera; este territorio es la base espacial y material de sus miembros, de su reproducción como pueblo, y expresa la unidad indisoluble hombre-tierra-naturaleza (art. 3).  Por otro lado el Capítulo VIII está dedicado al uso de los recursos naturales por parte de los pueblos indígenas y sus comunidades. El artículo 59 establece que los pueblos y comunidades indígenas, tendrán derecho a obtener los beneficios derivados del uso y aprovechamiento sostenible de los recursos naturales de sus tierras y territorios de conformidad con las disposiciones constitucionales y legales aplicables para que, en un marco de desarrollo integral, se supere su atraso económico y aislamiento.

Policy: Decree No. 411 of the Council of Ministers validating Regulation on establishment and delimitation of the boundaries of sanitary protection area and observation point of nuclear plant, and (or) also storage point, and the requirements for protection and management thereof.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes that sanitary protection area shall be set for the purpose of reducing hazardous impact of ionizing radiation originating from the use of nuclear energy on public health. Observation point shall be set with a view of obtaining reliable information on natural radiation background and radioactive pollution of the atmospheric air. Potential risks of nuclear plant and (or) storage point shall be determined in consideration of potential radiation impact on the population and environment in case of nuclear disaster. Nuclear plants and storage points shall be classified in three categories: (a) with possible radiation impact on the population requiring radiation shield; (b) with possible radiation impact limited to the personnel within sanitary protection area; and (c) with possible radiation impact on the personnel within nuclear plant and storage point. Sanitary protection area shall be set around nuclear plants and storage points of all categories while nearby nuclear plants and storage points of the first category shall be additionally set observation point.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA

Policy: Order No. 57-P of the Agency on land resources management validating the Regulation on land reclamation of disturbed land.
Policy_Content: This Order specifies elaboration of land reclamation projects related to soil cover disturbed by mining, exploration, construction and other works. Elaboration of land reclamation projects shall be subject to licensing. The following factors shall be taken into consideration in the process of elaboration of land reclamation projects: (a) natural conditions; (b) prospects of land use planning; (c) actual or foreseeable state of disturbed land; (d) agrochemical or agrophysical properties of soil; and (e) environmental protection requirements. Elaboration of land reclamation projects shall be carried out in the following cases: (a) after allotment of a plot of land the use of which shall entail soil disturbance – after decision of local self-government on land allotment and land transfer; (b) in case of change of specific land use – after decision by local self-government on change of specific (purposeful) land tenure; and (c) on previously disturbed land/soil in case of lack of information on the responsible for land/soil disturbance – by decision of local self-government body.

Policy: Model Statute of peasant farm.
Policy_Content: This Model Statute establishes that peasant farm shall become legal person from the moment of its state registration in accordance with the current legislation. Peasant farm shall be based upon personal labour of the members of household jointly carrying out farming on plot of agricultural land. Peasant farm shall be granted the right to carry out any authorized agricultural activity and processing of agricultural commodities. Peasant farm shall have the duty to use efficiently land plots in accordance with the purposeful use thereof, improve soil fertility, carry out soil protection arrangements and pay timely land tax and rent. Peasant farm may have plots of agricultural land in ownership.

Policy: Ley Nº 26.485 - Ley de protección integral para prevenir, sancionar y erradicar la violencia contra las mujeres en los ámbitos en que desarrollen sus relaciones interpersonales.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley establece normas de orden público cuya finalidad consiste en la eliminación de la discriminación entre mujeres y varones en todos los órdenes de la vida, así como la remoción de patrones socioculturales que promueven y sostienen la desigualdad de género y las relaciones de poder sobre las mujeres. La Ley garantiza los derechos fundamentales reconocidos a nivel internacional, incluidos el derecho a la salud y a la integridad física y económica o patrimonial. Se define como violencia contra la mujer de orden económico y patrimonial a aquella que ocasiona un menoscabo en los recursos económicos o patrimoniales de la mujer, a través de: a) la perturbación de la posesión, tenencia o propiedad de sus bienes; b) la pérdida, sustracción, destrucción, retención o distracción indebida de objetos, instrumentos de trabajo, documentos personales, bienes, valores y derechos patrimoniales; c) la limitación de los recursos económicos destinados a satisfacer sus necesidades o privación de los medios indispensables para vivir una vida digna; d) la limitación o control de sus ingresos, así como la percepción de un salario menor por igual tarea, dentro de un mismo lugar de trabajo.

Policy: Decree-Law No. 73/2009 approving the legal regime of the National Agricultural Reserve (RAN).
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law, consisting of 10 chapters and 2 Annexes, approves the legal regime of the National Agricultural Reserve (RAN). It establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of RAN, which in agro-climatic, geomorphological and pedological terms are more adequate for farming activity. RAN establishes a set of constraints to non-agricultural land use, taking into account the objectives of this regime in the different types of land. Objective of RAN are: to protect the soil resource, to support the development of agriculture; to contribute to the sustainable development of agriculture; to promote the competitiveness of rural areas and contribute to regional planning; to contribute to the preservation of natural resources; to ensure that the current generation respects the values to preserve, allowing for diversity and sustainability features to future generations; to contribute to ecological coherence of the Fundamental Nature Conservation Network, etc.

Policy: Order No. 77 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on state nature reserve of federal significance “Nenetsky”.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that on state nature reserve of federal significance “Nenetsky” shall be classified as biological (zoological) protected area destined for conservation and reproduction of rare and endangered wild fauna species constituted for an indefinite time period. Nature reserve shall be located in the Nenets autonomous district and shall be under the direct jurisdiction of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology. It shall perform the following tasks: (a) conservation of natural complexes; (b) conservation and reproduction of wild fauna species, including rare and endangered species; (c) scientific research; (e) ecological monitoring; and (d) ecological education. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of state nature reserve: (a) all types of hunting, except for traditional hunting by indigenous communities; (b) commercial, artisanal and sport fisheries; (c) timber extraction; (d) any activity causing modification of hydrogeological regime; and (e) collection of zoological species, including eggs and down hair.

Policy: Regional Law No. 18-OZ “On ecological monitoring”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes legal grounds for the application of territorial system of ecological monitoring, its basic provisions with a view of carrying out environmental observation, prevention of negative environmental impact and mitigation of the consequences thereof and provision of institutions and the population with environmental information. Territorial system of ecological monitoring is a multi-purpose and multi-level measurement and information system finalized for environmental data collection, processing, storage and dissemination (art. 2). Ecological monitoring shall carry out the following tasks: (a) regular environmental observation; (b) development of environmental information systems; (c) assessment of the efficiency of environmental arrangements under way; and (d) provision of information to state bodies and institutions of the state of environment and environmental pollution (art. 3). Ecological monitoring shall be based on the following principles: (a) scientific substantiation; (b) continuity; (c) uniformity and consistency of measurements and data; and (d) reliability of and accessibility to environmental information (art. 4).
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 110-pa validating the Regulation on regional state nature reserves “Alexandrovsky”, “Krasnogorsky”, “Nogliksky”, “Dobretskoye Lake”, “Ostrovnoy” and “Severny”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes that on state nature reserves of regional significance “Alexandrovsky”, “Krasnogorsky”, “Nogliksky”, “Dobretskoye Lake”, “Ostrovnoy” and “Severny” shall be classified as complex (environmental and zoological) protected area. The scope of constituting the aforesaid state nature reserves of regional significance shall be conservation and reproduction of precious natural complexes, including wetlands and tundra landscapes, and protection of rare and endangered fauna species (animals and birds). They shall perform the following tasks: (a) conservation of natural ecosystems and landscapes; (b) conservation of rare and endangered wild fauna species (brown bear, wild reindeer, sable (Martes zibellina), fox, glutton (Gulo gulo), rock capercaillie (Tetrao parvirostris), sea eagle (Haliaeetus), Arctic falcon (Falco gyrfalco), duck hawk (Falco peregrinus) etc.; and (c) protection of migratory routes and habitats, including wetlands. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of state nature reserve: (a) ploughing up; (b) all types of hunting and fisheries; (c) environmental and soil pollution; (d) timber extraction; (e) collection of eggs and down hair; (f) drainage and land reclamation; (g) destruction of vegetation; (h) waste disposal; and (i) passage and grazing of livestock.

The Decree provides rules relative to the granting of aid to: farmers with start-up activities; farmers on the basis of ownership arrangements; farmers for the commitment not to use arable land; aid to farmers on the basis of Article 16 of the Commission Regulation (EC) No 795/2004 of laying down detailed rules for the implementation of the single payment scheme provided for in Council Regulation (EC) No 1782/2003 establishing common rules for direct support schemes under the common agricultural policy and establishing certain support schemes for farmers; farmers on the basis of force majeure; farmers pursuant to Article 73a of the Commission Regulation (EC) No 796/2004 laying down detailed rules for the implementation of cross-compliance, modulation and the integrated administration and control system provided for in of Council Regulation (EC) No 1782/2003 establishing common rules for direct support schemes under the common agricultural policy and establishing certain support schemes for farmers.

Policy: European Communities (Good Agricultural Practice For Protection of Waters) Regulations 2009 (S.I. No. 101 of 2009).
Policy_Content: These Regulations provide rules relative to good agricultural practice to protect waters against pollution from agricultural sources and prescribe measures for these purposes, including: periods when land application of fertilizers is prohibited; limits on the land application of fertilizers; storage requirements for livestock manure; and monitoring of the effectiveness of the measures in terms of agricultural practice and impact on water quality. They also concern minimization and storage of soiled water and ploughing and the use of non-selective herbicides.

Policy: Coast Management Act.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to prescribe necessary matters concerning the efficient preservation, use, and development of coasts, thereby contributing to enhancing the preservation of the coastal environment, facilitating the sustainable development of coasts, and creating pleasant and affluent coasts as the basis for people's lives. In particular, the State and local governments shall formulate policies necessary to preserve, use and develop coasts in a sustainable manner. Furthermore, the State and local governments shall endeavor to increase the public awareness about the basic principles for coastal management, and to prevent any damage to the costal environment. The Act also provides for the establishment of the Central Committee for Deliberation on Coastal Management under the control of the Minister of Oceans and Fisheries to deliberate on the matters concerning coastal management listed in article 30. The text consists of 39 articles.

Policy: Resolution No. 4 of 2009 regulating and control of non-ionizing radiation resulting from electromagnetic fields.
Policy_Content: The aim of this Resolution is to regulate, inspect and control the exposition to electromagnetic fields in order to protect the public health. This Resolution is composed of 9 articles and 3 Annexes. Article 1 gives terms and definitions. Article 3 defines environmental requirements and conditions as well as maximum limits for the exposition to electromagnetic fields. Article 5 deals with the registration of electromagnetic equipment, instruments and apparatuses. Articles 6 and 7 pertain to the inspection and registers. Article 10 contains offences and penalties. Annexes I and II contain basic limits of RF until 10 GHz and from 10 to 300 GHz. Annex III contains reference levels to determine safe exposure for workers and the general public.

Policy: Renewables Obligation Order 2009 (S.I. No. 785 of 2009).
Policy_Content: This Order concerns discharge a renewables obligation by electricity suppliers, licensed under the Electricity Act 1989, who supply electricity in England or Wales. It also provides that renewables obligation shall be administered by the Gas and Electricity Markets Authority who is responsible for issuing renewables obligation certificates to renewable electricity generators on their renewable output. Instead of producing the required number of certificates in respect of all or part of their renewables obligation, a supplier is permitted to make a payment to the Authority. Renewable energy may be from waste or biomass and certificates may be issued in respect of electricity produced under an arrangement which was originally made pursuant to a Non-Fossil Fuel Order ("NFFO arrangement"). The Order also provides for calculation of the renewable output of a generating station.

Policy: Regulation on high radioactive contained resources and unclaimed resources.
Policy_Content: This Regulation sets forth the administrative and technical arrangements for the protection of human health against radioactive resources and for the control of  unclaimed resources. Public and private agencies as well as individuals involved in the production, installation, maintenance, importation, exportation, transportation, storage and use of radioactive resources which exceed the exemption limits must obtain a licence from the Atomic Energy Agency of Turkey. Licensees are obliged to provide adequate training to their employees against radiation. If an unclaimed radioactive resource is detected, thorough investigation must be conducted; furthermore, such resource must be sent to a radioactive waste facility.

Policy: Jammu and Kashmir Right to Information Act, 2009
Policy_Content: Under the provisions of this Act, any citizen within the state of Jammu and Kashmir may request information from a “public authority” (a body of Government or “instrumentality of State”) which is required to reply expeditiously or within thirty days. The Act also requires every public authority to computerize their records for wide dissemination and to proactively publish certain categories of information so that the citizens need minimum recourse to request for information formally. The Act provides the State government the power to set up State Information Commission that is required to inquire into any complaint filed by a citizen against a public authority for full or partial denial of information. The Act is applicable to every department and ministry of the State governments.

Policy: Order No. 65 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating Regulation on conservation area of state biosphere reserve “Kologrivskiy les”.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that conservation area of state biosphere reserve “Kologrivskiy les” shall be set on adjacent plots of land for the purpose of safeguarding protected area against negative anthropogenic impacts. The aforesaid plots of land shall not be expropriated from landowners, land tenants, lessees and servitude holders. Federal state enterprise biosphere reserve “Kologrivskiy les” shall be used for carrying out the following activities: (a) protection of natural complexes with a view of conservation of biological and landscape diversity; (b) research; (c) ecological monitoring; (d) ecological education; and (e) training of environmental protection personnel. The following activities shall be prohibited: (a) clean cutting; (b) creation of wood processing enterprises; (c) timber extraction from 31 March to 1 November; (d) logging; (e) creation of forest plantations; (f) industrial harvest and procurement on non-timber forest resources; (g) hunting; ; and (h) acclimatization of living organisms.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Law No. 1158-VI “On Amendments to Some Laws of Ukraine in Connection with the Adoption of the Law of Ukraine ‘On the State System of Biosafety at the Time of Creating,Testing, Transporting, and Using Genetically Modified Organisms’”.
Policy_Content: This Law implements Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety to the Convention on Biological Diversity. The present Law shall supplement the Law of Ukraine No. 1264-ХІІ “On Environmental Protection” dated June 25, 1991, with a new provision. According to this new provision, the competence of the specially authorized central body of executive power in the area of ecology and natural resources and its local bodies shall also include carrying out the advanced informed agreement procedure according to the requirements of the Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety to the Convention on Biological Diversity regarding the possibility of intentional transboundary movement of genetically modified organisms designated for intentional introduction into the natural environment. The present Law shall supplement the Law of Ukraine No. 45/95-VR “On Environmental Impact Assessment” dated February 9, 1995, with a new provision. This new provision shall establish that objects of environmental impact assessment shall also be drafts of legislative and other regulatory documents, preproject and project materials, documentation regarding the introduction of genetically modified organisms. The present Law shall introduce amendments to the Law of Ukraine No. 1775-ІІІ “On Licensing Certain Types of Business Activity” dated June 1, 2000. These amendments shall establish that genetic engineering activities in a closed system shall be subject to licensing.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Black Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Decree No. 1594 of 2009 defining fields of economic activities excluded from the Convention No. 148 of 1977 on the working environment (air pollution, noise and vibration).
Policy_Content: This Decree is composed of 5 articles. Article 1 excepts the following economic activities from the application of the International Labour Convention No. 148 of 1977: domestic workers and their employers; public services and utilities; security forces; air transport sector; works of maritime sector on board of ships non-registered in Lebanon; and, non-industrial agricultural works non-registered in the Commercial Register in Lebanon. Article 2 excludes temporary from the application of the Convention No. 148 of 1977 small and medium enterprises classified in accordance with Decree No. 5243 of 5 April 2001. Article 3 entrusts the High National Committee for Occupational Safety and Health. established by a decree of concerned and competent authorities with the following competencies: to propose applying texts for the implementation of the aforementioned Convention; to propose the organization of training seminars for persons charged to the control and inspection activities; to lay down and issue a detailed guidelines for criteria and instructions related to the work environment (air pollution, noise vibrations).  Article 4 gives the right to the aforementioned Committee to amend and modify the exceptions provided for in articles 1 and 2.

Policy: Ley Ambiental para el Estado de Chiapas.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley establece el marco normativo en materia ambiental para el Estado de Chiapas. Tiene por objeto la conservación de la biodiversidad, restauración del equilibrio ecológico, la protección del medio ambiente y el aprovechamiento racional de los recursos naturales para propiciar el desarrollo sustentable del Estado, estableciendo las bases para: a) reconocer y garantizar el derecho de los habitantes del Estado a gozar de un ambiente adecuado para su salud y bienestar; b) definir los lineamientos, principios, criterios e instrumentos de la política ambiental en el Estado; c) coordinar acciones entre el Estado y los Ayuntamientos de los municipios que lo conforman; d) promover el uso, manejo, conocimiento asociado y la distribución justa de los beneficios y costos derivados del aprovechamiento de los elementos de la biodiversidad y de los recursos genéticos; así como los conocimientos tradicionales de los pueblos indígenas relacionados con el aprovechamiento y manejo de los recursos naturales; e) garantizar el derecho de las comunidades y pueblos indígenas al uso y disfrute preferente de los recursos naturales localizados de los lugares que ocupen y habiten, así como a los ejidos y comunidades agrarias en los términos de la legislación aplicable; f) garantizar el derecho a la información actualizada acerca del medio ambiente y de los recursos naturales; g) promover el derecho de los habitantes del Estado a participar en la toma de decisiones, de manera individual o colectiva, así como en las actividades destinadas a la conservación, preservación y restauración del equilibrio ecológico, y al control de la contaminación del suelo, agua y aire. La Ley consta de los siguientes Títulos: I) Disposiciones generales; II) De la política ambiental en el Estado; III) De la biodiversidad y el aprovechamiento sustentable de los recursos naturales; IV) Areas naturales protegidas de competencia estatal; V) Protección al ambiente; VI) Regulación de actividades que pueden generar efectos nocivos; VII) Visitas de verificación, infracciones, sanciones, medidas de seguridad, medios de defensa y denuncia popular; VIII) De la responsabilidad por el daño ambiental.

Policy: Regional Law No. 152-ZZK “On regulation of land relations”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations in the field of use and protection of land on the regional territory within the powers, provided to the subjects (constituent entities) of the Russian Federation by Land Code of the Russian Federation and other federal laws. It sets forth legal regulation of land relations, establishes the powers of regional state legislative and executive bodies, and local government in the aforesaid sphere.This Act regulates land tenure and land protection. It establishes minimum and maximum area of agricultural land that can be allotted to citizens out of the stock of public and municipal land: (a) for peasant farms – from 0.04 ha to 0.50 ha; (b) for gardening - from 0.04 ha to 0.50 ha; (c) for horticulture - from 0.04 ha to 0.50 ha; (d) for stockbreeding - from 0.04 ha to 30 ha; and (e) for construction of suburban cottages - from 0.04 ha to 0.50 ha. Plots of public and municipal land can be allotted to citizens either for payment or free of charge to some categories of citizens listed in the art. 4. Expropriation of land plots for public and municipal needs, either for payment or free of charge, shall be authorized for the following purposes: (a) for city land-use planning, expansion of residential housing facilities; and (b) for expansion of protected areas.Documents prepared as a result of land survey, and documents establishing the intended specific land category, authorized use, use restrictions (encumbrances), location, description of boundaries, land area, are mandatory for land tenure, land management and disposal of land plot.

Policy: National Export Strategy.
Policy_Content: The National Export Strategy is a national sectoral strategy applicable to the export sector during the 2009-2030 period. The instrument seeks to improve Jamaica’s export performance by enhancing the trade and business environment and improving the competitiveness of firms and sectors. It will provide sector-specific measures to enhance key exporting industries, improve the bureaucratic processes for exporters, and strengthen a range of supporting services such as trade information and finance, export quality management, trade facilitation, branding, and trade promotion. The following are the main three goals of the Strategy: 1) achieving export-led growth; 2) improving export performance; 3) achieving global competitiveness. The priority sectors include agro-processing (food and beverages), aquaculture, coffee, minerals and mining.

Surface waterbodies pertaining to public property shall be considered waterbodies for common use: each citizen shall be granted of free access to waterbodies for navigation on small-size vessels free of charge and without conclusion of water management contracts. Navigation of the aforesaid vessels can be restricted, suspended or prohibited in cases envisaged by the acting legislation with timely information of the population. Navigation of unmarked and unregistered small-size vessels shall be prohibited.
Subject: Environment gen., Water

Policy: Regional Decree No. 73-pa/10 validating the Regulation on regional state nature biological reserve “Soyanovsky”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes that state nature biological reserve “Soyanovsky” shall be classified as wetlands protected area constituted with a view of conservation of the Soyana lake and river system, reproduction and replacement of wild fauna and wild flora species, including rare and endangered species, fishes, natural habitats thereof, protection of habitats and maintaining general ecological balance. The following activities shall be prohibited: (a) all types of hunting, destruction of nests, burrows, lairs, hollows, dams and collection of eggs; (b) timber extraction except for sanitary felling; (c) land reclamation and drainage of wetlands; (d) application of toxic chemicals, mineral fertilizers and pesticides; and (e) entry, passage and parking of motor vehicles.
Subject: Environment gen., Water, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Law on cultural heritage.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates the preservation and protection of the cultural heritage of the Republic of Bulgaria. The state shall ensure the protection of the cultural heritage regardless of its location. The cultural heritage encompasses the intangible and tangible immovable and movable heritage as a set of cultural values, which are bearers of historical memory, national identity and have scientific or cultural value. The cultural values shall be in public domain and shall be protected by state and municipal bodies in the interest of the citizens of the Republic of Bulgaria. Cultural values may be public and private property. They may be the property of the state, the municipalities, the Bulgarian Orthodox Church and other registered religions, as well as natural and legal persons. The cultural values, archeological sites, originating from the territory and the water area of the Republic of Bulgaria, are public state property. Cultural heritage assets, in terms of this Acts are: terrestrial, underground and underwater archaeological sites and reserves; historical objects complex; architectural complexes; 4. Ethnographic objects complex; form of park experience and landscape architecture; natural values (forms), incl. anthropological remains, discovered in-depth studies, iostans of paleozoology and cultivated plants; folk crafts and medicine; products of fine and applied arts; customs, rites, celebrations, rituals and beliefs; culinary and oenological traditions.

Policy: Resolution No. 130/09 approving the National Strategy on Food and Nutrition Security (2010-2025).
Policy_Content: This National Strategy on Food and Nutrition Security, consisting of 5 Thematic Topics and 4 Annexes, establishes the 7 Objectives to be achieved in order to contribute to the food security of Angola. These objectives are: 1 increasing and diversifying agricultural, livestock and fisheries production in a sustainable way in order to improve food access for the population and its living conditions; 2 ensuring the availability, stability and sustainability of food, promoting the interconnection between areas with surpluses and higher consumption in order to restore the internal market activity; 3 improving the conditions of access to food through the guarantee of social protection, especially for the most disadvantaged groups; 4 reducing the level of malnutrition by improving food access conditions, to primary health, education and sanitation services; 5 ensuring the health safety, quality of food and drinking water for human health and protection; 6 creating and implementing national and local early warning systems, monitoring for food and nutrition security systems as well as communication and information mechanisms to families system (SISAN); 7 creating a cross-sectoral platform for the coordinating policies and actions on food and nutrition security with the participation of civil society.

Policy: Scottish Soil Framework 2009.
Policy_Content: The Scottish Soil Framework is a national policy with a cross-sectoral approach. The main aim of the Framework is to promote the sustainable management and protection of soils consistent with the economic, social and environmental needs of Scotland. To this end, this Framework lays down strategies for (I) the protection of soil organic matter stock, (II) the reduction of soil erosion, (III) the maintenance of soil structure, (IV) the reduction of greenhouse gas emission from soils, (V) biodiversity conservation, (VI) sustainable flood management, (VII) water quality improvement, (VIII) increased production of food, timber and biomass, (IX) the reduction of soil contamination, (X) the reduction of pressure on soil, (XI) protection of historical and cultural features, (XII) awareness-raising on sustainable soil management, and (XIII) effective coordination of all stakeholders roles, responsibilities and actions.
